Contents.Synopsis: Upload new SPP Baseline to appliance firmware repository.
Contents.Description:
This Cmdlet provides the ability to upload a new SPP Baseline into the appliance.  It will return after the upload has completed but before the SPP file has been imported into the firmware repository.

After upload the baseline ISO, any . (period character) within the filename will be chaned to the _ (underscore character) by the appliance.  So, if a baseline ISo file name is 'bp.2016.04.custom.ISo', the appliance will change the filename to 'bp_2016_04_custom.iso'.

Parameters.Name: File
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-sppFile]

The full path and file name of the SPP file.  The function returns an error if the file path cannot be validated.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection resource object to initially associate with.  Resource can also be added to scope using the Add-HPOVResourceToScope Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: The progress of uploading the file to the appliance, and in-progress or completion result.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Upload SPP ISO to all connected appliances.

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will import an enclosure for HPE OneView management.  The Onboard Administrator needs to have at least an IP Address for each OA module, and a valid Administrator account.  An Enclosure Group must also be created.
	
Add-HPOVEnclosure will attempt a connection to the XML Reply interface to examine if an existing VC Domain is present.  If so, you are prompted if you wish to continue and force import the enclosure.  FORCE IMPORT OF AN ENCLOSURE WILL DELETE ANY EXISTING VC DOMAIN CONFIGURATION, AND NOT PERFORM ANY VC DOMAIN CONFIGURATION MIGRATION.  PLEASE BACKUP YOUR VC DOMAIN IF YOU WISH TO RESTORE TO ITS ORIGINAL CONFIGURATION.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-oa]

IP Address, Hostname or FQDN of the Primary C7000 Onboard Administrator (OA).

Parameters.Name: EnclosureGroup
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-eg, -enclGroupName]

Enclosure Group Name to associate with the enclosure to import.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-u, -user]

Administrator account of the target OA.  Can be either an OA Local Administrator or Active Directory (AD) account if the OA is configured for AD authentication.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-p, -pw]

Administrator Account password of the OA specified.  Value can be [String] or [SecureString].

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: LicensingIntent
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-license, -l]

Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.

Accepted values are

	* OneView
	* OneViewNoiLO

Parameters.Name: Baseline
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-fwIso, -fwBaselineIsoFilename]

Baseline File Name, Name, URI or Object.

Examples:

$FileName = "bp-hp-service-pack-for-proliant-oneview-2014-11-30-05.iso"
$Name = "HP Service Pack For ProLiant  OneView 2014 11 13"

Parameters.Name: ForceInstallFirmware
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-forceFw, -forceInstall]

 Force the installation of the provided Firmware Baseline.

Parameters.Name: Monitored
Parameters.Description: Add the specified enclosure for monitor only management.  You can view hardware for inventory and status information only.  Omitting this parameter, you can apply configurations, deploy server profiles, monitor operation status, collect statistics, and alert users to specific conditions.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Confirm
Parameters.Description: When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed.  If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an array of <HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeResource> Scope resource(s) to initially add.

InputTypes.Text: Enclosure Group Resource that will be used to set the Enlosure policy.

ReturnValues.Text: Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add a new enclosure to the appliance, using the EG1 Enclosure Group.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Add-HPOVEnclosure -oa "192.168.1.1" -enclGroupName EG1 -user admin -pass hpinvent -license OneView -confirm:$false
Add a new enclosure to the appliance, using the EG1 Enclosure Group, and force add the target enclosure.
Examples.Description: THIS IS A DISTRUCTIVE PROCESS IF AN EXISTING VC DOMAIN EXISTS.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add a new enclosure to the appliance for monitoring only.

Contents.Description: Import a power device (iPDU) to be managed by an HPE OneView appliance.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: Hostname of the iPDU, either IP Address or FQDN.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description:
Warning: This parameter is being deprecated. Please transition to the -Credential parameter.

Administrator account of the target iPDU.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description:
Warning: This parameter is being deprecated. Please transition to the -Credential parameter.

Account password of the iPDU specified.

Parameters.Name: Credential

Parameters.Name: TrustLeafCertificate
Parameters.Description: If the iPDU SSL certificate is not trusted, use this Cmdlet to add the certificate to the appliance trust store.

Parameters.Name: Async

Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

ReturnValues.Text: Async Task resource to monitor progress.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add the iPDU to the appliance.

Contents.Description:
Add a new SAN Manager to the appliance.  SAN Managers are hardware or software systems that manage SANs. The SAN Managers resource enables you to bring SAN management systems and the SANs they manage under management of the appliance. You can associate the managed SANs to Fibre Channel networks on the appliance when creating a (New-HPOVNetwork) or updating an existing (Set-HPOVNetwork) Fibre Channel Network Resource. This enables the appliance to automate zoning to make the SANs visible to server profiles. Zoning defines connections between Fibre Channel endpoints. Zones are a group of endpoints that can communicate with each other. Open SANs allow communication between all endpoints.

Supported SAN Managers are:

	* Brocade SAN Network Advisor
	* HPE Networking 5900CP  (FC or FCoE)
	* HPE Networking 5900AF (FC-only)
	* Cisco Nexus (FC or FCoE)
	* Cisco MDS (FC-only)
	
Please see the HPE OneView Support Matrix for supported versions.

Parameters.Name: Type
Parameters.Description:
SAN Manager type to add.  Accepted values are:

	* bna or Brocade Network Advisor
	* HP (HPN 5900CP or HPN 5900AF)
	* Cisco

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: FQDN or IP Address of the SAN Manager

Parameters.Name: Port
Parameters.Description: TCP Port of the SAN Manager.  The default port for Brocade Network Advisor is '5989'.  The default port for HPN 5900CP is '161'.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Username used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager.  This is only applicable for BNA SAN Manager.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Password used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager.  This is only applicable for BNA SAN Manager.  Can be either String or System.Security.SecureString type.

Parameters.Name: SnmpUserName
Parameters.Description: The SNMPv3 Community User Name.

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthLevel
Parameters.Description:
The SNMPv3 Authentication Level.  Allowed values are:

	* None - No Security is required, only the SNMPv3 UserName is provided.
	* AuthOnly - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security Level only. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol and -SnmpAuthPassword parameters.
	* AuthAndPriv - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security and Privacy Levels. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol, -SnmpAuthPassword, -SnmpPrivProtocol and -SnmpPrivPassword parameters.

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthProtocol
Parameters.Description:
SNMPv3 Password Encryption Protocol. Allowed values are:

	* SHA
	* MD5

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthPassword
Parameters.Description: SNMPv3 UserName Password.  Can be either String or System.Security.SecureString type.

Parameters.Name: SnmpPrivProtocol
Parameters.Description:
SNMPv3 Privacy Protocol.  Allowed values are:

	* AES
	* DES

Parameters.Name: SnmpPrivPassword
Parameters.Description: SNMPv3 Privacy Encryption Password.  Can be either String or System.Security.SecureString type.

Parameters.Name: UseSsl
Parameters.Description: Use to enable SSL communication with the SAN Manager (specifically for the BNA SAN Manager type.)

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$task = Add-HPOVSanManager -type BNA -hostname BNA.contoso.com -username Administrator -password password -usessl
Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task
Examples.Description: Add a new Brocade Network Advisor SAN Manager.

Contents.Description: Import a physical server.  This cmdlet is not used to add a Blade Server to the appliance, only supported DL Gen 8/9 servers.  A BL server will automatically be discovered once it inserted into an enclosure being managed by the appliance.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: Hostname of the server's iLO, either IP Address or FQDN.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Administrator account of the target iLO.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Account password of the iLO specified.  Can be String or SecureString.

Parameters.Name: LicensingIntent
Parameters.Description:
Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the server being imported.  This is only required when the -Monitored paraemter switch is not provided.  If you include the -Monitored switch, LicenseIntent is not required and should not be provided.

Accepted values are

    * OneView
    * OneViewNoiLO

Parameters.Name: Monitored
Parameters.Description: Add the specified server for monitor only management.  You can view hardware for inventory and status information only.  Omitting this parameter, you can apply configurations, deploy server profiles, monitor operation status, collect statistics, and alert users to specific conditions.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Confirm
Parameters.Description: When attempting to add a Server to the appliance, the appliance will validate the target Server is not already claimed.  If it is, this parameter is used when the server has been claimed by another appliance to bypass the confirmation prompt, and force add the server resource.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an array of <HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeResource> Scope resource(s) to initially add.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Returns an async task resource to monitor.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add serverilo.contoso.com to the appliance, with the OneView license.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add serverilo2.contoso.com to the appliance as a monitored only device.

Contents.Description: SMTP Email Filters can be created using this CMDLET.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Name of the Filter you are creating.

Parameters.Name: Filter
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-query]

REST API filter specifying the resource category, URI, name, and severity.  
	
Example:  CPU status:'warning' or status:'critical'

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Scope(s) the Filter should apply to.  Omitting parameter will apply filter to all defined scopes.  Value is an Array of <HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeResource> or <System.String> of 1 or more names of Scopes.

Parameters.Name: ScopeMatchPreference
Parameters.Description: If providing multiple Scope resources, specify AND or OR to indicate match preference.

Parameters.Name: Emails
Parameters.Description: Destination EMail address(es).

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

ReturnValues.Text: Returns an async task resource to monitor.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code: Add-HPOVSmtpAlertEmailFilter -Name 'Monitor CPU Error and Warning conditions' -query 'CPU status:warning or status:critical' -emails admin1@domain.com,admin2@domain.com
Examples.Description: Set SMTP Alert to notify when system CPU status is either 'warning' or 'critical', and email 2 addresses.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code: $Script:NewAlertFilterResults = Add-HPOVSmtpAlertEmailFilter -Name 'My Test Filter 3' -Filter 'status:critical' -Emails 'user1@domain.com','user2@domain.com' -Scope 'My new Scope','My new Scope2' -Async
Examples.Description: Create a new email critical alert for the two scope names, and return the Async Task object without waiting.

Contents.Description: Add new Storage Pools (i.e. HP 3PAR Common Provisioning Group [CPG]) for volumes to be provisioned from.  The Storage System must be imported prior to adding Storage Pools.

Parameters.Name: StorageSystem
Parameters.Description:
Aliases: [Hostname, Name]
The Storage System object, or Name.

Parameters.Name: Pool
Parameters.Description:
Aliases: [PoolName, spName, CPG]
An array containing the name(s) of the specific storage pool resource(s) to be added during storage system import.

Example: $pools = "cpg1","cpg2"

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Text: Storage System resource object from Get-HPOVStorageSystem.

ReturnValues.Value: Async Task(s) to monitor storage pool import.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add the "HP_CPG1" Stroage Pool that is mananaged in the HP3PAR_1 Storage System.  PoolName parameter data type will be converted from System.String to System.Collections.ArrayList .

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add the "HP_CPG1" Stroage Pool that is mananaged in the HP3PAR_1 Storage System.

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will assist with importing a supported Storage System. In order for the Storage Ports to be mapped to Expected Networks, either a Supported SAN Manager will need to be configured, or 3PAR Direct Attach networks will have to exist.

When adding supported HP 3PAR storage systems, please make sure "startwsapi" has been executed from the HP 3PAR CLI, which enables the HP 3PAR REST API that is required by HPE OneView.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: IP Address of FQDN of the storage systems.

Parameters.Name: Family
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Type]

Specify the type of Storage System to add: StorageVirtual or StoreServ.

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Administrator account of the target storage system.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Password of administrator account password.  Can either be String or System.Security.SecureString.

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: Specify the HP 3PAR Virtual Domain name.  Default is 'NO DOMAIN'. The value provided is CAsesEnSItive.

Parameters.Name: Ports
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Host Ports and Expected Network in an Array of PSCustomObject entries. 
	
Example: @{"1:1:1"="Fabric A";"2:2:2"="Fabric B"}

Parameters.Name: PortGroups
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Host Ports to group together. 
	
Example: @{"1:1:1" = "PG1"; "2:2:2" = "PG2"}

Parameters.Name: VIPS
ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: ShowSystemDetails
Parameters.Description: By default, the Cmdlet will no longer display the details about the Storage System.  Use this parameter to display information about the storage system when adding to the appliance.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add the Storage System using default settings, and let the appliance detect the connected Storage System Ports.  (A supported SAN Manager must first be added, and Managed SANs mapped to the specific FC Network resources.)

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add the Storage System using default settings, and specify the Storage System Ports that will be assigned to the Expected Networks.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$IscsiNetwork = Get-HPOVNetwork -Name "IscsiNetwork" -ErrorAction Stop
$StoreVirtualAddress = "storevirtual1.domain.com"
$StorageSystemPSCredential = Get-Credential -Username administrator
Add-HPOVStorageSystem -Family StoreVirtual -Hostname $StoreVirtualAddress -Credential $StorageSystemPSCredential -VIPS @{ "192.168.191.22" = $IscsiNetwork }
Examples.Description: Add a StoreVirtual storage system with PSCredential object.

Contents.Synopsis: Import an existing Storage Volume resource.
Contents.Description: This cmdlet will help add an existing storage volume that was provisioned on the Storage System.  The volume should not be exported or assigned to a server or groups of servers.  The Storage Volume also must reside in the Managed Domain of the Stroage System that the appliance managed.  The Storage Volume's WWN will be needed.

Parameters.Name: StorageSystem
Parameters.Description: The Storage System where the volume will be imported from.  Volume to be imported must be provisioned to the same Managed Domain as the Storage System.

Parameters.Name: VolumeID
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-volid, -id, -wwn]
The 128bit WWN FC address of the volume to be imported.  Address must be in the following format: AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:AA

Parameters.Name: StorageDeviceName
Parameters.Description: The Storage Systems' Device Name of the volume.  This can be found in either the 3PAR IMC, CLI or HPE SSMC by looking at the provisionined volume and copying the 'Name' property.

Parameters.Name: VolumeName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-name]
Specify the Storage Volume Name.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: Provide a description for the volume.

Parameters.Name: Shared
Parameters.Description:
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access.
Default: Private

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection resource object to initially associate with.  Resource can also be added to scope using the Add-HPOVResourceToScope Cmdlet.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Import the volume '50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C' from the '3ParSys1' Storage System.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Import the volume '50:00:2A:C0:03:1E:15:2C' from the '3ParSys1' Storage System.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Import a volume using the storage device name "MyStorageVolName1" on the '3ParSys1' Storage System.

Contents.Description: DEPRECATED as of 2.0.  Please use Set-HPOVAlert

Contents.Synopsis: Initiate a connection to an HPE OneView appliance.
Contents.Description:
Establish a connection with the specified HPE OneView appliance.  Logs the user into the appliance and establishes a session for use with subsequent requests.  Prompts will be displayed for any omitted values.

Appliance hostname or IP can include an alternate TCP port number.  While the appliance does not allow the default TCP port 443 to be changed, the appliance could reside behind a firewall, which is redirecting an alternate TCP port number.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance, -Computername]

The hostname or IP address of the appliance.

Parameters.Name: AuthLoginDomain
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-AuthProvider]

The Directory Name for LDAP/Active Directory authentication, or LOCAL for appliance internal user accounts.  
	
Default is determined by connecting to the requested appliance and retrieving the default login directory.  If not LOCAL, and you attempt to use an embedded user account, you must use -AuthLoginDomain parameter with the Local value..

Parameters.Name: UserName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-u, -user]

User name to authenticate.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-p]

Password to log into the appliance.  Can be either System.String or SecureString value..

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: LoginAcknowledge
Parameters.Description: When a Login Message has been configured and acknowledgement is Required, use this parameter to acknowledge it during the initial call.  Otherwise, if omitted, and a Login Banner acknowledgement is required, the caller will be prompted.  This prompt does not support the -Confirm parameter.

Parameters.Name: Certificate
Parameters.Description: Provide the X.509 certificate/SmartCard digital badge in order to authenticate to a supported appliance.  Two-factor authentication must be configured on the appliance in order to provide a X.509 certificate.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: On error, appliance response is returned as a terminating error.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Connect-HPOVMgmt -appliance myappliance.domain.com
ConnectionID Name                   UserName      AuthLoginDomain
------------ ----                   --------      ---------------
1            myappliance.domain.com Administrator LOCAL
Examples.Description: Connect to a specific appliance FQDN.  The user will be prompted for authentication provider, user name and password.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Connect to a specific appliance, where the target TCP port isn't the default.  The user will be prompted for authentication provider, user name and password.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$MySmartCard = gci Cert:\CurrentUser\my | ? { $_.EnhancedKeyUsageList.FriendlyName -match 'Smart Card Logon' }
Connect-HPOVMgmt -appliance myappliance.domain.com -Certificate $MySmartCard
Examples.Description: Connect to a specific appliance using a digital badge.

Contents.Synopsis: Create a Server Profile Template from Server Profile.
Contents.Description:
This CMDLET will allow the user to 'clone' or create a Server Profile Template from an existing Server Profile object.  Not all Server Profile features will be converted to a Server Profile Template.  For instance, the following features are not supported with a Server Profile Template:

	* Import existing local Smart Array Logical Disk configuration
	* Attach SAN Storage Volumes must be assigned a unique LUN ID

If the source Server Profile has the 'Import existing logical drives' enabled, this setting will be disabled, and the Local Disk Configuration policy will be set to 'disabled'.

If any SAN Storage Volume attachments contain an 'Auto' LUN value, it will be set to 'Manual', with the LUN ID set to a unique value based on the Array Index value.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-source, -name, -ServerProfile]

A source Server Profile Object or Resource Name.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: The Server Profile Template Name to assign.  If omitted, then a new name of 'Copy of - {Original_Name}' will be defined.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: The Server Profile description.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Text: A Server Profile resource object from Get-HPOVServerProfile.

ReturnValues.Text: Asyncronous task of the Server Profile Template creation request.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Use Get-HPOVServerProfile to retrieve the 'MyProfile' object, and pipe it to ConvertTo-HPOVServerProfileTemplate, creating a new Server Profile Template 'Hyervisor Gold Template 1'.

Contents.Synopsis: Convert an existing Storage Volume Snapshot to a Storage Volume.
Contents.Description: Storage Volume Snapshots can be converted to assignable and managed Storage Volume resources.  When converting a Snapshot to a Storag Volume, it will lose its parent/child relationship.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Snapshot]

Provide the snapshot resource object to convert managed by the appliance.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: The Storage Volume Name.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: The description of the storage volume.

Parameters.Name: SharingMode
Parameters.Description: Specify if the new storage volume should be Private or Shared.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return all storage volume resource objects.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$Snapshots = Get-HPOVStorageVolume 'Volume 1' | Get-HPOVStorageVolumeSnapshot
$Snapshots | ? { ((Get-Date $_.created -Format d) -eq (Get-Date 02/23/2016 -format d)} | ConvertTo-HPOVStorageVolume -Name 'Copy of Volume 1' | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete
Examples.Description: Get all of the available storage volume snapshots for 'Volume 1', then convert the snapshot created on the specified date to a storage volume resource.

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will copy a source Server Profile to a new instance  You can assign the copy to an existing Server Device, or 
specify 'unassigned'.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-sname, -src, -SourceName]
The Name or Resource Object of the source server profile to be copied.

Parameters.Name: DestinationName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-dname]
The name of the destination server profile that will be created.  If omitted, the new name will have "Copy of " 
prefixed to the source name.

Parameters.Name: Assign
Parameters.Description: The name, URI, or object of the target server to assign the new profile to.  If omitted, profile will be 'unassigned'

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Copy "Profile 1" to a new Server Profile that is unassigned and named "Copy of Profile 1".

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Copy "Profile 1" to a new Server Profile that is unassigned and named "Profile 2".

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will get the avilable and configured Address Pools, and their associated Ranges from the appliance.  Currently, the appliance supports the following Address Pools:
    
	* VMAC
	* VWWN
	* VSN
	* IPv4
    
You can specify one, some or all of the Pool types.  A Range switch is provided to include the associated Range objects.  A report switch is provided to display a report of each Address Pool type.

Parameters.Description: The Address Pool type.  Accepted values are VMAC, VWWN, VSN, IPv4, or All.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

Collection of Address Pools and their contents.

Examples.Description: Get the address pools.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Get the vmac address pool.

Contents.Description: Obtain all the alerts for the specified resource and/or with the specified severity.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-resourceUri]
Alerts for the specified resource will be returned.

Parameters.Name: Severity
Parameters.Description:
Alerts with given severity will be returned.  Allowed severity values are:

    * Unknown
    * Ok
    * Disabled
    * Warning
    * Critical

Parameters.Name: HealthCategory
Parameters.Description:
Alerts with given health category will be returned.  Allowed health category values are: 

    * Appliance
    * DeviceBay
    * Enclosure
    * Fan
    * Firmware
    * Host
    * Instance
    * InterconnectBay
    * LogicalSwitch
    * Logs
    * ManagementProcessor
    * Memory
    * Network
    * Operational
    * Power
    * Processor
    * RemoteSupport
    * Storage
    * Thermal
    * Unknown

Parameters.Name: AssignedToUser
Parameters.Description: Alerts assigned to the given user will be returned.

Parameters.Name: AlertState
Parameters.Description: Alerts with given alert state will be returned.  State values include Active and Cleared

Parameters.Name: Count
Parameters.Description: Return only the number of alerts from the appliance.  Can be combined with other parameters to return a pruned list of alerts.

Parameters.Name: Timespan
Parameters.Description: Return the number of alerts created from today to the defined number of days.

Parameters.Name: Start
Parameters.Description: Return alerts that were created starting from the specified date.  Hour, Min and Seconds will not be used, only Month, Day and Year of the DateTime value.

Parameters.Name: End
Parameters.Description: Return alerts that were created on the specified date.  Hour, Min and Seconds will not be used, only Month, Day and Year of the DateTime value.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Description: Return all the critical alerts.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return all the critical alerts for server 'Encl1, Bay 2'.

Examples.Description: Return all the alerts for server profile 'Profile 1'.

Examples.Description: Get all alerts for 'Encl1, interconnect 2' interconnect module.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Get 'critical' severity alerts for 'Encl1, interconnect 2' interconnect module.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return the first 5 'critical' severity alerts.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return 'critical' severity alerts for the past 8 days.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 8 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return 'critical' severity alerts Starting at 2016-12-01 to now.

Examples.Description: Return all alerts Starting at 2016-12-01 to 2016-12-09.

Contents.Description:
This CMDLET displays the appliance or connected appliancces Date and Time configuration.  Part of this is the actual Date and Time of the appliance, Time Zone, NTP Servers, NTP polling, and Locale.

When queriying a Virtual Machine Appliance and the NTPServers property or field is Null, the appliance will retrieve its Date and Time from the Hypervisor Host.

When queriying a Synergy Composer appliance and the NTPServers property or field is Null, the appliance will retrieve its Date and Time from the System ROM.

Contents.Description:
HPE OneView provides the ability to save your configuration settings and management data to a backup file and enables you to use that backup to restore a corrupted appliance in the event of a catastrophic failure.

The backup process involves creating a backup file and then downloading that file so that you can store it to a safe and secure (off-appliance) location for future use. You can schedule automatic backup operations and designate a remote location for the backup file.

This Cmdlet will get the automatic backup configuration from the connected appliance(s).  Use Set-HPOVAutomaticBackupConfig to set a new automatic backup policy for the appliance(s).

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Multiple appliance automatic backup configuration objects.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Get-HPOVAutomaticBackupConfig
Appliance Enabled Server             Protocol Directory Interval Days         Time
--------- ------- ------             -------- --------- -------- ----         ----
Appliance True    scphost.domain.com SCP                WEEKLY   {MO, WE, FR} 18:00
Examples.Description: Get the configured automatic backup setting of the appliance.

Contents.Description:
Retrieves the list of SPPs that have been uploaded to the appliance, and their detail.  You can examine the included components and their versions reported by the baseline.

Please note that any file name that contains the . (period, CHAR46) character will be replaced with _ (underscore, CHAR95).

Example: My.Spp.To.Upload.201605.iso will become My_Spp_To_Upload_201605.iso.

Parameters.Name: File
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-isoFileName, -FileName]

The ISO file name of an SPP.

Parameters.Name: SppName
Parameters.Description: The SPP/Baseline Name.

Parameters.Name: Version
Parameters.Description: If multiple SPP/Baselines with the same name exist, use the Version parameter to filter to the specific SPP/Baseline version.

Filter resources based on provided Scope membership.  By default, all resources for the accounts Active Permissions will be displayed.  Allowed values:

	* AllResources
	* AllResourcesInScope
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ConnectionPermission

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Value: The firmware-baseline object or collection of firmware-baseline objects if no sppFile is provided in the command.

Examples.Description: Retrieves all SPP objects from the appliance and stores them in the sppCollection object

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

Contents.Description:
Determine if the EULA for the specified appliance needs to be accepted.  This is typically called during First Time Setup of the appliance.

This Cmdlet supports an unauthenticated request.  If attempting to get the EULA status of an appliance not yet configured, provide the IP Address or FQDN of the appliance.  A temporary ApplianceConnection will be created then removed in the ${Global:ConnectedSessions} tracker.

Parameters.Name: Appliance
Parameters.Description: The FQDN, IP Address or HPOneView.Appliance.Connection of an HPE OneView appliance must be provided.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Object that returns the Appliance Name and if the EULA has been accepted with a boolean 'Accepted' property.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Get-HPOVEulaStatus -Appliance myappliance.domain.com

Appliance              Accepted
---------              --------
myappliance.domain.com    False
Examples.Description: Get the EULA status from myappliance.domain.com

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$Connection = Connect-HPOVMgmt -Appliance myappliance.domain.com -Username Administrator -Password MyPassw0rd
Get-HPOVEulaStatus -Appliance $Connection

Appliance              Accepted
---------              --------
myappliance.domain.com    False
Examples.Description: COnnecto to an appliance, then get the EULA status from myappliance.domain.com

Contents.Synopsis: Gets the installed licenses on the appliance.
Contents.Description: This Cmdlet will retrieve licenses installed on the appliance.  You can use this to get an inventory of what's installed and what licenses are consumed.

Parameters.Name: Type
Parameters.Description: Specify the type of License to retrieve.  Valid options are "HP_ONE_VIEW" or "HP_ONE_VIEW_WO_ILO".

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description: Specify the license state to retrieve.  Valid options are "Unlicensed" or "Permanent".

Parameters.Name: Summary
Parameters.Description: Display a condensed summary view of the installed or required licenses.  This does not return a License object that can be used with Remove-HPOVLicense.

Parameters.Name: Report
Parameters.Description:
PARAMETER IS BEING DEPRECATED.

Generate a report of installed or required licenses, their type and assigned Nodes.

Get-HPOVLicense

Product   : HPE OneView Advanced
Type      : Permanent
Capacity  : 64
Allocated : 30
Available : 34
Nodes     : {Encl2, bay 7, Encl2, bay 4, Encl2, bay 13, Encl1, bay 8...}
Examples.Description: Retrieve all installed license objects on the connected appliance(s).

Contents.Description: Obtain a collection of network resources which have the specified type and/or name.  The default connection information is included in the returned network resources.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: The name of the network resource to be returned.  All network resources will be returned if omitted.  Supports '*' wildcard character.

Parameters.Name: Type
Parameters.Description: The type of the network resource to be returned.  Valid types are "Ethernet" for Ethernet networks, "FC" or "FibreChannel" for Fibre Channel networks.  All network resources will be returned if omitted.

Parameters.Name: Purpose
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Ethernet Purpose value to filter on.

Supported Values:

	* General
	* Management
	* VMMigration
	* FaultTolerance
	* ISCSI

	Note: When using this parameter, only Ethernet networks will be returned.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description:
Filter resources based on provided Scope membership.  By default, all resources for the accounts Active Permissions will be displayed.  Allowed values:

	* AllResources
	* AllResourcesInScope
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ConnectionPermission

Parameters.Name: Label
Parameters.Description: Specify the label name the network resource is associated with.  Cannot be combined with Name.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Description:

Description:
Register with Hewlett Packard Enterprise to allow automatic case creation for hardware failures on servers and enclosures and to enable Proactive Care. Once enabled, all eligible devices added in the future will be automatically enabled for remote support.
Eligible devices are Gen8 and newer blades and enclosures.
NOTE: Servers must be at iLO 2.1 firmware level or above to be enabled for remote support
Hewlett Packard Enterprise will contact you to ship a replacement part or send an engineer for devices that are under warranty or support contract.
Remote support enables Proactive Care services including Proactive Scan reports and Firmware/Software Analysis reports with recommendations that are based on collected configuration data.
Remote support is secure. No business data is collected, only device-specific configuration and fault data. All communications are outbound only and use industry standard TLS encryption ensuring confidentiality and integrity of the information.
Once the appliance is configured, it cannot be unauthorized or disabled.
Use this Cmdlet to get the appliance's current Remote Support configuration.  This Cmdlet does not return device collection data or schedules.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Value: The setting object with updated parameters.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Get-HPOVRemoteSupport
Appliance              Enabled Company   AutoEnableDevices MarketingOptIn InsightOnlineEnabled
---------              ------- -------   ----------------- -------------- --------------------
myappliance.domain.com True    MyCompany False             False          False
Examples.Description: Returns the existing Remote Support configuration of the appliance.

Contents.Synopsis: Get State Change Message Bus certificates.

Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Save]
Directory to store the SSL certificates.  If the directory doesn't exist, it will be created.

Parameters.Name: ConvertToPFx
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-pfx]		
Convert rabbitmq_readonly client certificate to PFX format for .Net consumption.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Password that will be used to encrypt the PFX client certificate.

Parameters.Name: InstallApplianceRootCA
Parameters.Description: hoose to install the appliance root certificate to the current users Trusted Root Authorities store.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Text:
* {ApplianceConnection_Name}_ca.cer - Appliance internal Root Certificate Authority
* {ApplianceConnection_Name}_cert.cer - Appliance managed rabbitmq_readonly user Public Key
* {ApplianceConnection_Name}_privateKey.key - Appliance managed rabbitmq_readonly user Client Certificate

ReturnValues.Text: If ConvertToPfX is used, the Pkcs12/PFX compliant certificate file is created, {ApplianceConnection_Name}_privateKey.pfx

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will obtain a collection of Server Profile resources, or a specific Server Profile the specified name. It returns all aspects of the Server Profile.
    
This will also provide the ability to export Server Profile objects to their own JSON encoded file.  All appliance unique properties (minus the Server Hardware Type, Enclosure Group, and Connection Network assignment) are removed.  Connection layout, assigned addresses, networks, bandwidth, BIOS, Boot Order, Firmware settings will all be retained.  Assigned Address types will change from Virtual to UserDefined in order to retain their assignment.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description: Profile a Server Hardware or Server Profile Template resource, and the associated Server Hardware will be returned.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-profile]
The name of the server profile resource to be returned.  All server profile resources will be returned if omitted.  Supports * wildcard character.

Parameters.Name: Detailed
Parameters.Description: Display detailed report list of Server Profiles

Parameters.Name: NonCompliant
Parameters.Description: Return collection of Server Profiles that are not compliant with their template.  Will not return Server Profiles that have no Template association.

Parameters.Name: Unassigned
Parameters.Description: Optional parameter that can be included with the List switch parameter to only display unassigned Server Profiles.  Can also be combined with the name parameter for Server Profile wildcard name search.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description:
Filter resources based on provided Scope membership.  By default, all resources for the accounts Active Permissions will be displayed.  Allowed values:

	* AllResources
	* AllResourcesInScope
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ConnectionPermission

Parameters.Name: Label
Parameters.Description: Specify the label associated with resources.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: export
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-x]
Switch used to export Server Profile object to JSON encoded file.

Parameters.Name: location
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-save]
Location where to save the Server Profile

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Get-HPOVServerProfile 
Profile Name   Managing BIOS Managing Firmware Assigned      State
------------   ------------- ----------------- --------      -----
Copy of test 2         False             False Unassigned    Normal
Profile 11              True              True Encl1, bay 11 Normal
Profile 12             False             False Encl1, bay 12 Normal
Profile 13             False             False Encl1, bay 13 Normal
Profile 14             False             False Encl1, bay 14 Normal
Profile 15             False             False Encl1, bay 15 Normal
Profile 16             False             False Encl1, bay 16 Normal
Test 1                 False             False Unassigned    Normal
test 2                 False             False Encl1, bay 3  Normal
test 3                 False             False Unassigned    Normal
Examples.Description: Generate a list of all server profiles.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return the server profile resource with name "SA".

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will obtain a collection of Server Profile Template resources, or a specific Server Profile Template with the specified name. It 
returns all aspects of the Server Profile Template.
    
This will also provide the ability to export Server Profile Template objects to their own JSON encoded file.  All appliance unique properties (minus the Server Hardware Type, Enclosure Group, and Connection Network assignment) are removed.  Connection layout, assigned addresses, networks, bandwidth, BIOS, Boot Order, Firmware settings will all be retained.  Assigned Address types will change from Virtual to UserDefined in order to retain their assignment.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: The name of the specific Server Profile Template resource to retrieve

Parameters.Name: ServerHardwareType
Parameters.Description: Provide the Server Hardware Type resource object or name to return Server Profile Templates designed for it.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description:
Filter resources based on provided Scope membership.  By default, all resources for the accounts Active Permissions will be displayed.  Allowed values:

	* AllResources
	* AllResourcesInScope
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection
	* HPOneView.Appliance.ConnectionPermission

Parameters.Name: Label
Parameters.Description: Specify the label associated with resources.

Parameters.Name: Detailed
Parameters.Description: Displays detailed information about the Server Profile Template in tabular format

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Export
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-x]
Switch used to export Server Profile Template object to JSON encoded file.

Parameters.Name: Location
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-save]
Location where to save the Server Profile Template file.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return all the server profile  templates managed by the appliance.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return the server profile template resource with name "SA".

Test 1                 False             False Unassigned    Normal
test 3                 False             False Unassigned    Normal

------------   ------------- ----------------- --------      -----
Test 1                 False             False Unassigned    Normal

Contents.Description: Obtain a collection of task resources which have the specified name and/or state.  The returned data will include the task name, owner, state and status.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-TaskName]
The name of the task resource to be returned.  All names will match if omitted.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description: Related resource Name or Object to the task. To be used for filtering tasks specific to a resource object (i.e. Server Profile).

Parameters.Name: ResourceCategory
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Category]
Specify the Resource Category to filter task results to.  Cannot be combined with Resource parameter.

Some examples are:

	* ethernet-networks
	* fc-networks
	* power-devices
	* unmanaged-devices
	* server-profiles
	* server-hardware
	* enclosures
	* enclosure-groups
	* interconnects
	* logical-interconnects
	* logical-interconnect-groups
	* appliance
	* firmware-drivers

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description:
The state of the task resource a to be returned. May be one of the following strings:
            
	* Unknown
	* New
	* Running
	* Suspended
	* Terminated
	* Killed
	* Completed
	* Error
	* Warning
	
All states will match if omitted.  All tasks will be returned if both names and state are omitted.

Parameters.Name: Count
Parameters.Description: Specify the maximum amount of task objects to return.  0 will return all found task objects.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Text: Resource Object to retrieve task resources of

ReturnValues.Text: Multiple Task resources or formatted table list of tasks

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return all the tasks with a taskState='Error'

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return completed (successful) tasks associated with the 'Server 1' Server Profile.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Display the 10 most recent tasks from the specified appliance connection.

Contents.Description:
By default, the HPE OneView appliance creates a self-signed SSL Certificate for its WebUI.  There might be a desire to trust the certificate, in case the SHA-1 hash becomes invalid (either due to a certificate change or man-in-the-middle attack) and the caller would like to be notified.  This cmdlet will assist in retrieving and storing the appliance self-generated SSL Certificate into the current users Trusted Root Certification Authorities store.

Please note that the Subject Alternate Name (SAN) must match that of the Appliance hostname you use to connect to your appliance.  If it does not, an SSL conenction failure will ocurr.  When creating a CSR on the appliance, make sure to include the additional FQDN and IP address(es) in the Alternative Name field.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Import the SSL certificate from the specific appliance.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Connect-HPOVMgmt Myappliance.domain.com Administrator MyP@ssword
Connect-HPOVMgmt Myappliance2.domain.com Administrator MyP@ssword
$ConnectedSessions | Import-HPOVSslCertificate
Examples.Description: Import the SSL Certificate from all connected sessions.

Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

ReturnValues.Text: Async task resource object to monitor committing certificate, and deploying HPE SSO certificate update to managed/monitored devices

Examples.Description: Read the signed SSL certificate private key and install it on the appliance, and wait for the task to complete.

Contents.Description:
Use this cmdlet to install/update the Logical Interconnect (i.e. Virtual Connect) firmware.  You can provide the Logical Interconnect Name, URI or Object and must specify a valid SPP Baseline present on the appliance.

This cmdlet will default to performing an Update (Stage + Activate), which will cause an outage.  If you wish to avoid an outage, first stage the update usind -method stage, then -method activate.  Interconnect activation can be controlled with the -ActivateOrder parameter, which defaults to Odd interconnects.  Once the specified interconnect activation is complete, you must then call the cmdlet again with the alternate ActivateOrder value (i.e. even.)

Parameters.Name: LogicalInterconnect
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-li, -uri, -name]
The Logical Interconnect object(s), name(s) or uris(s) to be updated.

Parameters.Name: Method
Parameters.Description:
Upgrade method to perform.  Accepted values are:

	* UPDATE (Default)
	* STAGE
	* ACTIVATE

Parameters.Name: EthernetActivateOrder
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-order, -ActivateOrder]
Specify the Ethernet module firmware activation order.  Accepted values are:

	* OddEven (Default)
	* Parallel
	* Serial

Parameters.Name: EthernetActivateDelay
Parameters.Description:
The amount of time in seconds to delay activating additional modules.

Default is 5 seconds.

Parameters.Name: FCActivateOrder
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Fibre Channel module firmware activation order.  Accepted values are:

	* OddEven
	* Parallel
	* Serial (Default)

Parameters.Name: FCActivateDelay
Parameters.Description:
The amount of time in seconds to delay activating additional modules.

Default is 5 seconds.

Parameters.Name: Baseline
Parameters.Description: Firmware Baseline Name, URI or Object.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: Force
Parameters.Description: Force the firmware update if the update version matches what is already installed.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

ReturnValues.Text: Returns an async task resource to monitor.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$li = Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Encl1-LI
$spp = Get-HPOVSppFile "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" 
$task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Stage $li $spp 
Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task
$task = Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware Activate $li 
Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task
Examples.Description: Perform a firmware update of the Encl1-LI Logical Interconnect by first staging the firmware. Then Acitate the firmware using the default OddEven Interconnect Bay order.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code: Get-HPOVLogicalInterconnect Encl1-LI  | Install-HPOVLogicalInterconnectFirmware -method Update -baseline "HP Service Pack for ProLiant" -confirm:$false | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete
Examples.Description: Perform a firmware update of the Encl1-LI Logical Interconnect, do not prompt for confirmation, then wait for the task to complete.

Contents.Synopsis: Migrate Virtual Connect Manager to HP OneView.
Contents.Description:
This function is used to migrate an existing Virtual Connect Manager configuration to HP OneView.  If an enclosure was added to an HP OneView appliance as Monitor-Only, then you must first remove the enclosure from the appliance, and then use this cmdlet to migrate the enclosure.
    
Using the -VCEMCMS, -VCEMUser and -VCEMPassword parameters, the targeted Virtual Connect Domain can be removed from a Virual Connect Enterprise Manager Domain Group first before initiating the VC Migration tool within the HP OneView appliance.
    
The required VCEM 7.3/7.4 Patch is available here:  ftp://ftp.hp.com/pub/softlib2/software1/pubsw-generic/p270829882/v106568.
    
VCEM 7.4.1 or greater users do not require the patch to be installed, as the API is built into 7.4.1 or greater.
    
It is important to also have a Virtual Connect Domain Backup prior to migration.  You may also want to gather the output from the 'show config -includepoolinfo' VCM CLI command to review or verify resources were migrated successfully.
    
Please read 'Chapter 9 Planning for enclosure migration from VCM into HP OneView' in the HP OneView 1.20 User Guide for more information about migration and other planning resources.

Parameters.Name: OAIPAddress
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-oaip]
REQUIRED. IP address or FQDN of the Primary Onboard Administrator in the target enclosure.

Parameters.Name: OAUserName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-ou]
REQUIRED. Administrator account of the target OA.

Parameters.Name: OAPassword
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-op]
REQUIRED. Password for the Administrator account of the target OA.

Parameters.Name: VCMUserName
Parameters.Description: Aliases [-vu]

Parameters.Name: VCMPassword
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-vp]
REQUIRED. Password for the Administrator account of Virtual Connect Manager.

Parameters.Name: EnclosureGroup
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-eg]
OPTIONAL. The Name, URI or Object of an existing Enclosure Group.  If the Enclosure Group Name does not exist, a new resource with the String value provided will be created.  If omitted, a new Enclosure Group will be created based on the Serial Number of the Enclosure (Example: 'EG_USE1234567A').

Parameters.Name: LogicalInterconnectGroup
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-lig]
OPTIONAL. The Name, URI or Object of an existing Logical Interconnect Group.  If the Logical Interconnect Group Name does not exist, a new resource with the String value provided will be created.  If omitted, a new Logical Interconnect Group will be created based on the Serial Number of the Enclosure (Example: 'LIG_USE1234567A').

Parameters.Name: licensingIntent
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-license, -l]
REQUIRED. Specifies whether the intent is to apply either OneView or OneView w/o iLO licenses to the servers in the enclosure being imported.

Accepted values are
                    
	* OneView
	* OneViewNoiLO

Parameters.Name: VCEMCMS
Parameters.Description: The IP Address or FQDN of the VCEM host.

Parameters.Name: VCEMUser
Parameters.Description: Administrator level account name available on the VCEM host.

Parameters.Name: VCEMPassword
Parameters.Description: Administrator level account password on the VCEM host.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: Report
Parameters.Description: OPTIONAL. Execute the migration report only. Do not execute the migration process.

Parameters.Name: Export
Parameters.Description:
REQUIRED if the -report switch is provided.  The directory path in which to save the report output to a file.

	* Filename will be created in the format: [path]\{enclsoureName}_{date}.report

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Text: Valid Enclosure Group resource the appliance will migrate the source enclosure into

ReturnValues.Text: Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Remove the profile specifed by name. Wait for remove to complete.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Remove the profile specifed by $profile. Disable confirmation prompt.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Get-HPOVServerProfile | Remove-HPOVServerProfile
Search for all profiles and remove them from appliance.Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -licensingIntent OneView
Examples.Description: Migration will occur and create a new Enclosure Group and new Logical Interconnect Group based on the enclosure serial number.

Examples.Code: Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -eg "EnclosureGroup1" -licensingIntent OneView

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------

Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -licensingIntent OneView -report -export "c:\VCM-MigrationReports"
The migration report will be executed and the result saved to the file "c:\VCM-MigrationReports\{enclosureName}_{date}.report".
Examples.Description: Migration will not be attempted.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
Examples.Code: Invoke-HPOVVcmMigration -OAIPAddress 192.168.19.40 -OAUserName Administrator -OAPassword hpinvent -VCMUserName Administrator -VCMPassword hpinvent -licensingIntent OneView -VCEMCMS vcemcms.contoso.com -VCEMUser Domain\Adminisrator -VCEMPassword MyPassword
Examples.Description: Perform a migration of a VCEM managed enclosure to HP OneView.

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will assist with creating a new Address Pool Range.  The support Address Pool Types are MAC Addresses (VMAC), Fibre Channel/FCoE World Wide Name (VWWN), Server Serial Number (VSN), and IPv4 Address Pools (IPv4).

When creating new Address Pool Ranges, the Generated Range Type will allocate 1,048,576 MAC or WWN addresses, whereas it will allocate 46,656 Serial Numbers.

If you specify a Custom Range Type, you must specify a range of addresses no smaller than 128, and no more than 1,048,576 per range.

Custom Address Ranges must adhere to the following format rules:

	* The MAC Address must be IEEE Compliant, and the format must be XH:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX, where H must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, A, C or E.

    Example:  12:22:33:44:55:00

	* The WWN Address must be IEEE compliant, and the format must be 10:00:XH:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX, where H must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, A, C or E.

    Example:  10:00:6C:9F:06:B0:00:00

	* The Serial Number addresses must start with VCU, and cannot contain more than 10 characters total.

    Example:  VCU1234567

IPv4 Address Subnets do not support Auto Generated, as the RangeType parameter is not required.  When creating a new IPv4 Address Subnet, you must provide a unique Name, Subnet Mask (CIDR [e.g. 24] or IPv4 Address Value [e.g. 255.255.255.0]), Start and End IPv4 Address, Gateway and Domain Name.  DNS Servers are optional.  To add more Address Ranges to a Subnet after creating it, please use the Add-HPOVAddressRange CMDLET.

Parameters.Name: IPv4Subnet
Parameters.Description: The IPv4 Subnet that the new IPv4 Range will be assigned to.  Start and End values must be within the Network ID and Subnet value of the IPv4 Address Subnet Pool.

Parameters.Name: PoolType
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Pool Type the new Range will be assinged to.  Accepted values are:

	* VMAC
	* VWWN
	* VSN

Parameters.Name: RangeType
Parameters.Description:
The type of Address Range to create (not applicable for IPv4 Address Pools/Subnets).  Accepted values are:

	* Generated
	* Custom

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Provide the IPv4Address Pool Range Name.

Parameters.Name: Start
Parameters.Description: The starting address in the range.  Cannot overlap with other address ranges, and should be unique within the datacenter/infrastructure.

Parameters.Name: End
Parameters.Description: The ending address in the range.  Cannot overlap with other address ranges, and should be unique within the datacenter/infrastructure.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). 

When attempting to create a new IPv4 Address Pool/Subnet, only a single HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value is allowed.  If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Text: IPv4 Address Subnet resource object from Get-HPOVAddressPoolSubnet

ReturnValues.Text: Newly created and assigned Address Pool Range resource object

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new Appliance generated VMAC Pool Range.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new VWWN Address Pool Range with the custom addresses, for the MyAppliance1.domain.com appliance connection.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new IPv4 Address Pool Range, for the MyAppliance1.domain.com appliance connection.

Contents.Description:

To add IPv4 Address Ranges to a Subnet after creating it, please use the New-HPOVAddressPoolRange CMDLET.

Contents.Description: This cmdlet will create the CSR for an given appliance, to then be submitted to a CA.

Parameters.Name: Country
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-C]
The country code in either Full English or ISO3166-2 two-character format, is a required entry and must contain only two letters.

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-ST, -Province]
The state or province is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: City
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-L, -Locality]
The city or locality is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: Organization
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-O]
The organization name is a required entry, can contain up to 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: CommonName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-CN]
The common name is a required entry, and can be FQDN/hostname or IPv4/IPv6 address. 

Example: "hpov.example.com"

Parameters.Name: OrganizationalUnit
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-OU]
The entry for the organizational unit name, may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: AlternativeName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-SAN]
An optional entry containing additional names that apply to the owner of the certificate, possibly including additional e-mail addresses, DNS names, IP addresses and other identifiers. 

Example: "hpov.example.com,hpov,192.168.1.1"

Parameters.Name: ContactName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Contact]
The name of the contact person, may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: Email
Parameters.Description: The contact person's email address, which may not exceed 128 characters and is of the format name@domain.

Parameters.Name: Surname
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Sur]
The contact person's family name, which may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: GivenName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Giv]
The contact person's first name, which may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: Initials
Parameters.Description: The contact person's initials, which may not exceed 20 characters.

Parameters.Name: DNQualifier
Parameters.Description: The distinguished name qualifier, which further identifies the certificate recipient, which may not exceed 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: ChallengePassword
Parameters.Description: The challenge password is a required entry and must contain a minimum of 8 characters.  If you wish to be prompted to supply the password, use an asterisk (*) character.

Parameters.Name: UnstructuredName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-UN]
Defined by the certificate authority, and may contain up to 64 characters.  Consult the certificate authority's administrator or documentation for more information.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Object that contains the base64data property, which can then be written to a file or submitted to CA

Examples.Description: Create a CSR request to submit to CA.

Contents.Synopsis: Generate and download or remote save appliance backup.
Contents.Description:
HPE OneView provides the ability to save your configuration settings and management data to a backup file and enables you to use that backup to restore a corrupted appliance in the event of a catastrophic failure.

The backup process involves creating a backup file and then downloading that file so that you can store it to a safe and secure (off-appliance) location for future use. You can schedule automatic backup operations and designate a remote location for the backup file.

Use this cmdlet to generate and download an appliance configuration backup file for backup purposes.  The backup file does not contain user account passwords.  The backup file is not meant to restore to other appliance for quick provisioning, as it is an encrypted TAR GZIP file.

If an automatic backup policy is configured on the appliance, the Cmdlet is instruct the appliance to offload the newly created backup to the remote location.  If you wish to download the backup, use the -Location and -Force parameters, which will initiate a download to the value provided.

Parameters.Name: Location
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-save]

The full path to where the Support Dump will be saved to.  The downloaded file name will be generated by the appliance.  If the directory does not exist, it will be created. By default will use current directory.

Parameters.Name: Force
Parameters.Description: The Cmdlet will validate if the appliance is configured to save backup files to a remote location.  Use this option to force download the backup file instead of copying to the remote location.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Value: The generated backup File if appliance is not setup for remote storage or the Force parameter is used.

ReturnValues.Text: Async task to create the backup file.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: This command will generate a new backup, and if a remote location is configured, will initiate the file transfer.  If not configured, then the Cmdlet will download the file to the current working directory.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: This command will save the Appliance backup file to C:\Temp

Contents.Synopsis: Create Custom Baseline from Hotfixes and Source Baseline.
Contents.Description: HPE ProLiant Hotfixes are released out of the main SPP release cycle.  Administrators can use HPSUM external to HPE OneView to create a custom baseline, but then need to upload to the appliance.  Hotfixes can be directly uploaded to an HPE OneView 2.0 Appliance, with the ability to create a Custom Baseline by using a source Baseline (which must exist in the Baseline Repository) and specified Hotfix(s).

Parameters.Description:
Array of Hotfix filenames, or Component name.  
	
Example: @(cp111111.exe,cp222222.scexe,cp333333.exe,cp444444.scexe)

Parameters.Name: BaselineName
Parameters.Description:
The final custom Baseline name.

Example: custom_SPPGen9Snap3_2015_0327_82

Parameters.Description: Provide an HPOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection resource object to initially associate with.  Resource can also be added to scope using the Add-HPOVResourceToScope Cmdlet.
