Contents.Synopsis: Sends a request to the management appliance
Contents.Description:
Receives the request input, properly constructs and formats the request header and body and sends the request to the management appliance.  This is the main cmdlet that interacts with the appliance.

The message body can contain valid JSON data, with the correct URI and accepted HTTP method accepted by the target resource manager.  Please see the on-appliance Resource Model for more information (https://[appliance_IP]/help/cic/en/content/images/api/.)

Parameters.Name: Uri
Parameters.Description: The uri that identifies the required resource on the appliance.

Parameters.Name: Method
Parameters.Description:
The request HTTP Method.

	* "GET" (default) to get a resource from the appliance (read)
	* "POST" to create a new resource
	* "PUT" to modify a resource (write)
	* "PATCH" to modify a resource (write), with specific attributes set to values, other attributes should be set to $null.
	* "DELETE" to delete a resource

Parameters.Name: Body
Parameters.Description: Body for the request.  Required if the method is POST or PUT.

Parameters.Name: Start
Parameters.Description:
For GETs on resource collections, this specifies the starting index in the collection.
If not specified, collection members starting from the beginning are returned.

Parameters.Name: Count
Parameters.Description:
For GETs on resource collections, this specifies the number of collection members to return.
If not specified, all members of the collection are returned from this function.

Parameters.Name: AddHeader
Parameters.Description: If additional headers are needed/required than the defaults, include header names and values within a Hashtable.

Parameters.Name: OverrideContentType
Parameters.Description: Workaround to override ContentType where needed (e.g. PATCH /rest/scopes/{GUID}.

Parameters.Name: OverrideTimeout
Parameters.Description: Specify to override the HttpWebRequest syncronous timeout being made.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description:
The destination appliance to process the request.  When specifying a Value, it must match the HostName attribute of a valid HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object within the Global $ConnectedSessions variable.  If no match is found, or no HPOneView.Appliance.Connection objects exist, an error will be thrown.

Default Value: All valid Appliance Connections within $Global:ConnectedSessions

InputTypes.Value: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Returns all the enclosure objects managed by the appliance.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Updates the name of the enclosure object specified by the uri and Appliance Connection name.

Contents.Description:
Alerts can be in one of two administratively controlled states: Active or Cleared.  This Cmdlet allows the administrator to change the status of an alert to either Active or Cleared.

In order for an Administrator to change the status of an Alert, the Administrator must be assigned to the respective resource role (Network, Server, Storage, or Infrastructure.)

Parameters.Description: The alert to be cleared.  Can be URI or resource object.

Parameters.Name: AssignToUser

Parameters.Name: Notes
Parameters.Description: Notes of the action for the alert.

Parameters.Name: Cleared

Parameters.Description: Change the alert to 'Active' status.

Contents.Description: When establishing multiple Appliance Connections, this Cmdlet will help set one of the appliance connections stored in the ${Global:ConnectedSessions} variable to the default connection.  All Cmdlets that require a specific Appliance Connection will use the default.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
[Aliases -Connection]

Either the HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object, full or partial value of the connection objects Name property.

InputTypes.Text: The Appliance Connection object either provided from the Connect-HPOVMgmt output or ${Global:ConnectedSessions} variable

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$ConnectedSessions
ConnectionID Name                    UserName      AuthLoginDomain Default Connection
------------ ----                    --------      --------------- ------------------
1            Appliance1.domain.local administrator LOCAL           True
2            Appliance2.domain.local administrator LOCAL           False

Set-HPOVApplianceDefaultConnection 'Appliance2'

ConnectionID Name                    UserName      AuthLoginDomain Default Connection
------------ ----                    --------      --------------- ------------------
1            Appliance1.domain.local administrator LOCAL           False
2            Appliance2.domain.local administrator LOCAL           True
Examples.Description: Display the current appliance connections, then set the new default to 'Appliance2' using the parital name value.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$ConnectedSessions
ConnectionID Name                    UserName      AuthLoginDomain Default Connection
------------ ----                    --------      --------------- ------------------
1            Appliance1.domain.local administrator LOCAL           True
2            Appliance2.domain.local administrator LOCAL           False

$ConnectedSessions[1] | Set-HPOVApplianceDefaultConnection

ConnectionID Name                    UserName      AuthLoginDomain Default Connection
------------ ----                    --------      --------------- ------------------
1            Appliance1.domain.local administrator LOCAL           False
2            Appliance2.domain.local administrator LOCAL           True
Examples.Description: Display the current appliance connections, then set the new default to 'Appliance2' using the pipline by passing the HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object.

Contents.Description:
Introduced in HPE OneView 3.0, an automatic appliance backup schedule can be configured.  The automatic backup process will generate the backup file, then transfer it to a host that supports SCP or SFTP.  The hosts public SSH key will be needed in order to successfuly configure.

During the configuration process, a test file will be created and stored on the host.  This file can be safely deleted once the async task has successfully completed.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: The IP Address or FQDN of the target SCP or SFTP host.

Parameters.Name: Directory
Parameters.Description: The remote directory on the host where the file will be saved to.  Omit to sepcify the root or default directory the user account is associated with.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: The username to authenticate to the SCP/SFTP host with.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description:
The password of the user.

Specify the Logical Interconnect URI or Object the Support Dump will be generated for, from pipeline.

Parameters.Name: HostSSHKey
Parameters.Description: The SCP/SFTP hosts public key, in OpenSSH String format.

Parameters.Name: Protocol
Parameters.Description:
The protocol to connect to the remote host with.  Supported values are:

	* SCP
	* SFTP

Default: SCP

Parameters.Name: Interval
Parameters.Description:
The frequency the backup will be generated.  Supported values are:

	* Daily
	* Weekly

Parameters.Name: Days
Parameters.Description:
If specifying a Weekly backup, provide the days in an Array.  Accepted values are:

	* SU or SUN or Sunday
	* MO or MON or Monday
	* TU or TUE or Tuesday
	* WE or WED or Wednesday
	* TH or THUR or Thursday
	* FR or FRI or Friday
	* SA or SAT or Saturday

Parameters.Name: Time
Parameters.Description: The time to execute, in 24hr clock.

Parameters.Name: Disabled
Parameters.Description: Disable the automatic backup schedule.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Multiple appliance async task to monitor

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$HostSSHKey = Get-Content C:\host.key
Set-HPOVAutomaticBackupConfig -Hostname scphost.domain.com -Username backupadmin -Password (ConvertTo-SecureString password -AsPlainText -Force) -HostSSHKey $HostSSHKey -Protocol SCP -Interval Weekly -Days 'MON','WED','FRI' -Time 18:00
Examples.Description: This command will configure automatic appliance backup, based on a weekly Monday, Wednesday and Friday schedule to execute at 18:00 (6:00PM).

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$HostSSHKey = Get-Content C:\host.key
Set-HPOVAutomaticBackupConfig -Hostname scphost.domain.com -Username backupadmin -Password (ConvertTo-SecureString password -AsPlainText -Force) -HostSSHKey $HostSSHKey -Protocol SCP -Interval Weekly -Days 'MON','WED','FRI' -Time 18:00
New-HPOVBackup
Examples.Description: This command will configure automatic appliance backup, based on a weekly Monday, Wednesday and Friday schedule to execute at 18:00 (6:00PM).  Then, a call to New-HPOVBackup will be made, which will generate and copy the backup file to the remote location configured.

Contents.Description: Use this cmdlet to set the default Authentication Directory on the appliance.  Use Get-HPOVLdapDirectory to pass in the directory to configure as the default.  Once the Default Directory is set, the CMDLET will configure a Registry Key (HKCU:\Software\Hewlett-Packard\HPOneView) called "AuthProvider#{ApplianceConnectionName}".  The Library will read this value upon load and use it as the default value for the -AuthDirectory parameter in Connect-HPOVMgmt.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Directory]
Provide the Directory Name, URI or Object.  If you want to set the Authentication Directory back to Local, specify LOCAL as the name.

Parameters.Name: DisableLocalLogin
Parameters.Description: Use to disable appliance local login accounts.  You cannot use this parameter if an Authentication Directory is not configured.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Set-HPOVLdapDefaultDirectory -InputObject "Domain1"
# CMDLET will create:
# HKCU:\Software\Hewlett-Packard\HPOneView\AuthProvider#MyAppliance.domain.com REG_SZ, value = "Domain1"
Examples.Description: Set 'Domain1' as the default authentication directory for the appliance.  Then, the CMDLET will create the REG_SZ "AuthProvider#MyAppliance.domain.com" with a value of "Domain1".

Contents.Synopsis: Assign or change roles for LDAP Groups.
Contents.Description: Changes current roles of an LDAP Group with a given set of roles.  You must provide the list of all roles the LDAP Group should be set to, and not a subset of roles.

Parameters.Name: AuthProvider
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-d, -domain, -directory]

LDAP/Active Directory Domain Name

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-g, -GroupName, -Group]

Directroy Group to add.

Parameters.Name: Roles
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-r, -role]
The role(s) to assign to the Directroy Group, in System.Collections.ArrayList format.  Accepted values are noted within the ApplianceRoles property of the HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object stored in the $Global:ConnectedSessions variable.

Example: $roles = "Server administrator","Network administrator"

Parameters.Name: UserName
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-u]

Directory Username to authenticate with

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-p]

Directory User account password

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: ScopePermissions
Parameters.Description:
Array collection of Hashtable<Role; Scope>.  Will overwrite existing scope to role mappings.

Example: -ScopePermissions @{Role = 'Network administrator'; Scope = (Get-HPOVScope -Name CorpNetAdmins -ErrorAction Stop) }

ReturnValues.Text: Updated LDAP Group object with new role assignment(s)

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code: Set-HPOVLdapGroupRole -d Domain1 -GroupName "MY Directory Group1" -roles "Server administrator" -u 'Sarah Peterson'
Examples.Description: Add "MY Directory Group1" from Domain1 with Server Administrator role and prompt for password for group validation.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$roles = "Server administrator","Backup administrator"
$password = convertto-SecureString -asplaintext "password123890" -force
Set-HPOVLdapGroupRole -d Domain1 -GroupName "MY Directory Group1" -roles $roles -u 'Sarah Peterson' -p $password
Examples.Description: Set "MY Directory Group1" from Domain1 with Server and Backup administrator roles, and specify password for group validation.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$LdapDirectoryName = 'CorpDomain'
$MyAdCreds = Get-Credential
Get-HPOVLdapGroup -Group $CorpNetworkAdmins -ErrorAction Stop | ? loginDomain -eq $LdapDirectoryName | Set-HPOVLdapGroupRole -ScopePermissions @{Role = 'Network administrator'; Scope = $NewSBACScope } -Credential $MyAdCreds
Examples.Description: Change the Scope permissions for the specified authentication directory group.

Contents.Description: Configure the Login Message for the connected appliance(s).  You can also set the Acknowledgement to be required.

Parameters.Name: Acknowledgment
Parameters.Description: Set to True if the login message should be acknowledged before authentication completes.  If set to True, the COnnect-HPOVMgmt Cmdlet will prompt the user to acknowledge the message, if -LoginAcknowledge is not provided in the Cmdlet parameters.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection

Aliases [-Appliance]

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

Set-HPOVLoginMessage -Message '************************************
>> *****        WARNING        ********
>> ************************************
>> Updated Message: This management appliance is a company owned asset and provided for the exclusive use of authorized personnel. Unauthorized use or
>> abuse of this system may lead to corrective action including termination, civil and/or criminal penalties.'

>>
Set-HPOVLoginMessage -Message $Message -Acknowledgment $true

Contents.Synopsis: Enable or Disable Automated SAN Zoning.
Contents.Description: This cmdlet is used to Enable or Disable a Managed SAN resource on the appliance.  Disabling a Managed SAN will prevent the appliance from configuring FC Zones.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Fabric, -Name, -ManagedSan]

Managed SAN Name or Object.

Parameters.Name: EnableAutomatedZoning
Parameters.Description: (DEPRICATED - Please use -ZoningPolicy parameter.) Enable Automated Zoning for the specified Managed SAN.  When used, the default Zone Policy 'SingleInitiatorAllTargets' is set.

Parameters.Name: DisableAutomatedZoning
Parameters.Description: (DEPRICATED - Please use -ZoningPolicy parameter.) Disable Automated Zoning for the specified Managed SAN.

Parameters.Name: ZoningPolicy
Parameters.Description:
Policy setting that affects the way that zones are created. Allowed values:

	* NoZoning - Disable all automated zoning on the SAN and ignore policy settings related to zoning.
	* SingleInitiatorAllTargets - Create one zone per initiator containing all targets connected to that initiator.
	* SingleInitiatorSingleStorageSystem - Similar to SingleInitiatorAllTargets except that separate zones are created for targets that reside on different storage systems.

Parameters.Name: EnableAliasing
Parameters.Description: Enable aliases to be created for initiators, targets and target groups based on the specified name formats

Parameters.Name: DisableAliasing
Parameters.Description: Disable aliases to be created for initiators, targets and target groups based on the specified name formats

Parameters.Name: InitiatorNameFormat
Parameters.Description:
Format to use for initiator alias names. The following built-in variables can be used: {hostName}, {initiatorName}, {initiatorWwn}.

Example: "initiator_{hostname}_{initiatorName}"

Parameters.Name: TargetGroupNameFormat
Parameters.Description:
Format to use for target group (ex. storage system port group) alias names. The following built-in variables can be used: {storageSystemName}, {targetGroupName}.

Example: "TargetGroup_{storageSystemName}_{targetGroupName}"

Parameters.Name: TargetNameFormat
Parameters.Description:
Format to use for target (ex. storage system port) alias names. The following built-in variables can be used: {storageSystemName}, {targetName}.

Example: "Target_{storageSystemName}_{targetName}"

Parameters.Name: ZoneNameFormat
Parameters.Description:
Format to use when naming new and updated zones. The following built-in variables can be used: {hostName}, {initiatorName}, {initiatorWwn}, {storageSystemName}, {targetName}, {targetGroupName} 

Example: "{initiatorWwn}_{initiatorName}"

Parameters.Name: UpdateZoneNames
Parameters.Description:
Format to use when naming new and updated zones. The following built-in variables can be used: {hostName}, {initiatorName}, {initiatorWwn}, {storageSystemName}, {targetName}, {targetGroupName} 

Example: "{initiatorWwn}_{initiatorName}"

Parameters.Name: UpdateInitiatorAliases
Parameters.Description:
Format to use when naming new and updated zones. The following built-in variables can be used: {hostName}, {initiatorName}, {initiatorWwn}, {storageSystemName}, {targetName}, {targetGroupName} 

Example: "{initiatorWwn}_{initiatorName}"

Parameters.Name: UpdateTargetAliases
Parameters.Description:
Format to use when naming new and updated zones. The following built-in variables can be used: {hostName}, {initiatorName}, {initiatorWwn}, {storageSystemName}, {targetName}, {targetGroupName} 

Example: "{initiatorWwn}_{initiatorName}"

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------

Contents.Description: Modify a network and it's attributes information.  Use this cmdlet to change the Network Name, Purpose, Enable or Disable Smartlink, Enable or Disable Private Network, and adjust the allocated bandwidth.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-net, -Network]
The Name or Resource object of the network to be modified.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: The network resource's new Name value.

Parameters.Name: Prefix
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to add a new prefix to the name.  Will not change the original name value, simply add the prefix to the orignal name.  Use the -Name parameter to adjust the entire name.

Parameters.Name: Suffix
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to add a new suffix to the name.  Will not change the original name value, simply add the suffix to the orignal name.  Use the -Name parameter to adjust the entire name.

Parameters.Name: Purpose
Parameters.Description:
A description of the network's role within the logical interconnect.  Accepted values in string format are:

	* General
	* Management
	* VMMigration
	* FaultTolerance

Parameters.Name: Smartlink
Parameters.Description: Enable or Disable Smartlink within the Ethernet Network.

Parameters.Name: PrivateNetwork
Parameters.Description: Enable or Disable Private Network within the Ethernet Network.

Parameters.Name: TypicalBandwidth
Parameters.Description: Preferred amount of bandwidth to assign within the Server Profile Connection, specified in Mbps.

Parameters.Name: MaximumBandwidth
Parameters.Description: The maximum bandwidth of a network connection, that will be allowed and reflected witin the Server Profile Connection, expressed in Mbps. In Flex10 adapters, the maximum supported Ethernet bandwidth is 10 Gbps. With 10Gb FlexFabric adapters, the maximum FCoE bandwidth is 8Gbps. With FlexFabric 20Gb adapters, the maximum Ethernet bandwidth is 20Gbps.

Parameters.Name: LinkStabilityTime
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-lst]
The time in seconds the appliance waits before reconnecting to a link that was previously offline (Login redistribution). This interval prevents connection loss due to reconnecting to a link that is unstable (going online and offline repeatedly).  Parameter is only supported with FibreChannel network resources.

Minimum Value: 1
Maximum Value: 1800

Parameters.Name: AutoLoginRedistribution
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-ald]
Used for login balancing when logins are not distributed evenly over the Fibre Channel links (for example, when an uplink that was down becomes available).  Parameter is only supported with FibreChannel network resources.

True: Login redistribution is initiated automatically when the link stability time expires.
False: Login redistribution must be initiated manually.

Parameters.Name: ManagedSan
Parameters.Description: Managed SAN Name or URI.

Parameters.Name: IPv4Subnet
Parameters.Description: Associate with IPv4Subnet.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

ReturnValues.Text: The Update Network Resource Task object

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Get the 'Net-11' Ethernet Network, pipe it to Set-HPOVNetwork to update values.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$fabricAManagedSan = Get-HPOVManagedSan -Name "Fabric A"
Get-HPOVNetwork "Prod Fabric A" | Set-HPOVNetwork -ManagedSan $fabricAManagedSan  | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete
Examples.Description: Update 'Prod Fabric A' FC Network with 'Fabric a' Managed SAN resource.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Get all Ethernet networks, and add a Suffix to their names.

Contents.Synopsis: Configure Remote Support and authorize appliance.
Description:
Register with Hewlett Packard Enterprise to allow automatic case creation for hardware failures on servers and enclosures and to enable Proactive Care. Once enabled, all eligible devices added in the future will be automatically enabled for remote support.
Eligible devices are Gen8 and newer blades and enclosures.
NOTE: Servers must be at iLO 2.1 firmware level or above to be enabled for remote support
Hewlett Packard Enterprise will contact you to ship a replacement part or send an engineer for devices that are under warranty or support contract.
Remote support enables Proactive Care services including Proactive Scan reports and Firmware/Software Analysis reports with recommendations that are based on collected configuration data.
Remote support is secure. No business data is collected, only device-specific configuration and fault data. All communications are outbound only and use industry standard TLS encryption ensuring confidentiality and integrity of the information.
Once the appliance is configured, it cannot be unauthorized or disabled.

Parameters.Name: CompanyName
Parameters.Description: The company name Remote Support will be authorized for.

Parameters.Name: OptimizeOptIn
Parameters.Description: Opt-in to allow HPE marketing to discuss datacenter optimization.

Parameters.Name: InsighOnlineUsername
Parameters.Description: The user name of your Insight Online account.

Parameters.Name: InsightOnlinePassword
Parameters.Description: The Insight Online account password.

Parameters.Name: Enable
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to enable remote support on an appliance, only if the appliance was previously configured for Remote Support and it was disabled.

Parameters.Name: Disable
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to disable remote support globally on the appliance.  Use the -Enable parameter to re-enable Remote Support.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: The appliance Remote Support configuration applied.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Configure and register the applinace for Remote Support.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Configure and register the applinace for Remote Support, and enable Insight Online portal registration.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Disable Remote Support on the appliance.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Enable Remote Support after it was previously disabled for the specific appliance.

Contents.Description: Updates an existing SAN Manager configuration.  Can update the hostname/IP Address and credentials.  At least one optional parameter must be provided.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-name]
Resource Object (from Get-HPOVSanManager) or Name of the SAN Manager to update.  If specifying a resource Name, the ApplianceConnection parameter is required.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: Updated Hostname or IP Address of the SAN Manager.

Parameters.Name: Port
Parameters.Description: Updated TCP Port of the SAN Manager.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Updated Username used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Updated Password used to authenticate and manage the SAN Manager.  Can either be a String or SecureString value.

Parameters.Name: SnmpUserName
Parameters.Description: The SNMPv3 Community User Name.

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthLevel
Parameters.Description:
The SNMPv3 Authentication Level.  Allowed values are:

	* None - No Security is required, only the SNMPv3 UserName is provided.
	* AuthOnly - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security Level only. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol and -SnmpAuthPassword parameters.
	* AuthAndPriv - SNMPv3 Authentication Encryption Security and Privacy Levels. Must also provide -SnmpAuthProtocol, -SnmpAuthPassword, -SnmpPrivProtocol and -SnmpPrivPassword parameters.

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthProtocol
Parameters.Description:
SNMPv3 Password Encryption Protocol. Allowed values are:

	* SHA
	* MD5

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthPassword
Parameters.Description: SNMPv3 UserName Password.  Can either be a String or SecureString value.

Parameters.Name: SnmpPrivProtocol
Parameters.Description:
SNMPv3 Privacy Protocol.  Allowed values are:

	* AES
	* DES

Parameters.Name: SnmpPrivPassword
Parameters.Description: SNMPv3 Privacy Encryption Password.  Can either be a String or SecureString value.

Parameters.Name: EnableSsl
Parameters.Description: Enable Secure WBEM communications to Brocade SAN Network Advisor.

Parameters.Name: DisableSsl
Parameters.Description: Enable Secure WBEM communications to Brocade SAN Network Advisor.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code: $task = Get-HPOVSanManager bna.domain.com -ApplianceConnection hpov.domain.com | Set-HPOVSanManager -hostname bna.newdomain.com | Wait-HPOVTaskComplete
Examples.Description: Get the SAN Manager using Get-HPOVSanManager, and pipling the resource in order to update the hostname value.

Examples.Description: Update the existing Brocade Network Advisor SAN Manager's username and password.

Contents.Synopsis: [DEPRECATED] Set the power state of a server.
Contents.Description: This Cmdlet is now deprecated.  Please use the Start-HPOVServer, Stop-HPOVServer or Restart-HPOVServer Cmdlets.

Parameters.Name: Server
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-name, -uri, -serverUri]

The server object, URI or Name, or can be a Server Profile object.

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description: Optional power state.  Default is On, other option is Off

Parameters.Name: PowerControl
Parameters.Description: Optional setting to control the virtual power button.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-appliance]
The name of the appliance or list of appliances to execute the command against.

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet configures the SMTP settings for the appliance.  SMTP settings include deining the Sender EMAIL Address, SMTP relay server address, SMTP relay server TCP port, optional password, and if SMTP alerting is enabled or disabled.

Currently, HPE OneView does not support Secure SMTP, even though the TCP Port can be modified.  Using the SmtpPort parameter is to specify an alternate TCP Port than the default TCP/25.

Parameters.Name: SenderEmailAddress
Parameters.Description: Specify the Sender Email Address for the appliance.

Parameters.Name: Server
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-SmtpServer]
Specify the SMTP Relay Server if DNS does not contain a valid DNS MX record for the sender email address domain name.

Parameters.Name: Port
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-SmtpPort]
Provide an alternate TCP port number than the default SMTP port value 25/TCP.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Provide an SMTP Password to authenticate to the SMTP Server.  This password will be sent in clear text to the SMTP server.

Parameters.Name: AlertEmailDisabled
Parameters.Description: Disable SMTP Email Alerting.

Parameters.Name: AlertEmailEnabled
Parameters.Description: Enable SMTP Email Alerting

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: ConnectionSecurity
Parameters.Description:
Use to specify if the target SMTP server requires TLS security/authentication.  Supported values:

	* None
	* TLS
	* StartTls

InputTypes.Value: None. You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: The finished Task object that includes the task result

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Set the appliance's SMTP Sender Email Address to 'hpov-alerts@contoso.com' and enable SMTP Email Alerting.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Set the appliance's SMTP Sender Email Address to 'hpov-alerts@contoso.com' and enable SMTP Email Alerting.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Set the appliance's SMTP Sender Email Address to 'hpov-alerts@contoso.com', enabling SMTP Email Alerting and specifying StartTls connection security.

Contents.Description: Set a new SNMP Read Community value on the appliance.  Updating this value will cause the appliance to refresh the managed devices with the updated Read-Only SNMP Community string.  This does not update the SNMP trap destination(s) for Logical Interconnects or Logical Interconnect Groups.

Parameters.Name: name
Parameters.Description: The name of the new SNMP Read-Only Community.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.
Text: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Set the appliance SNMP Read Community string to the new value.

Contents.Synopsis: Modify an existing Storage Volume resource.
Contents.Description: This cmdlet will help modify an existing Storage Volume resource.  Only the Volume Name, Description, Capcity, volume shared state and permenance can be modified.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-SourceVolume]
Source Storage Volume resource object.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-VolumeName]

Updated Storage Volume Name.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: Updated description for the volume.

Parameters.Name: Capacity
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-size]
New Max volume capacity in GB.  Volume capacity can be increased to maximum of 16 TiB. Decreasing the capacity of volume is not supported. 

Before increasing the capacity of fully provisioned volumes, ensure that the storage pool has enough capacity to support the operation. The update operation might fail if there is not enough space available in the storage pool.

e.g. 20 to specify 20GB.

Parameters.Name: SnapShotStoragePool
Parameters.Description: The Storage Pool Name, URI or Object to be used for Volume Snapshots.

Parameters.Name: Shared
Parameters.Description:
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access.
Default: Private

Parameters.Name: DataProtectionLevel
Parameters.Description:
Specify the new StoreVirtual data protection level (aka Network RAID).  Allowed values:

	* NetworkRaid0None
	* NetworkRaid5SingleParity
	* NetworkRaid10Mirror2Way
	* NetworkRaid10Mirror3Way
	* NetworkRaid10Mirror4Way
	* NetworkRaid6DualParity

Parameters.Name: PermitAdaptiveOptimization
Parameters.Description:
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access.
Default: Private

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Update 'ProdVol1' volume size to 160GB.

Contents.Synopsis: Set Storage Volume Template Global Policy
Contents.Description: By default, Storage Volumes can be created without reference to a Storage Volume Template.  This cmdlet will allow the administrator to change the global policy setting.  Use with caution, as this will prevent copying Server Profiles that contain attached Storage Volumes.

Parameters.Name: Enable
Parameters.Description: Switch to enable the policy

Parameters.Name: Disable
Parameters.Description: Switch to disable the policy

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.
InputTypes.Text: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet

ReturnValues.Text: Returned boolean value after changing policy

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Get-HPOVStorageVolumeTemplatePolicy
Appliance               Name                          Value
---------               ----                          -----
MyAppliance.domain.com  StorageVolumeTemplateRequired true

Set-HPOVStorageVolumeTemplatePolicy -disable -ApplianceConnection $ConnectedSessions

Appliance               Name                          Value
---------               ----                          -----
MyAppliance.domain.com  StorageVolumeTemplateRequired false
MyAppliance2.domain.com StorageVolumeTemplateRequired false
Examples.Description: Get the Storage Volume Template Global Policy setting, then disable it for all connected appliances.

Contents.Description: Modify or update an existing local user account on the management appliance.  This cmdlet will not update the password or roles of the currently logged in user account.  To update your HPE OneView appliance local account's password, please use the Set-HPOVUserPassword cmdlet.

Parameters.Name: UserObject
Parameters.Description: The object of the user account to be updated.

Parameters.Name: UserName
Parameters.Description: The name or object of the user account to be updated.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: New password for the user account.  Passwords must be at least 8 characters.

Parameters.Name: FullName
Parameters.Description: Updated Full Name of the User Account.

Parameters.Name: Roles
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-r, -role]
The role(s) to assign to the Directroy Group, in System.Collections.ArrayList format.  Accepted values are noted within the ApplianceRoles property of the HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object stored in the $Global:ConnectedSessions variable.

Example: $roles = "Server administrator","Network administrator"

Parameters.Name: EmailAddress
Parameters.Description: Updated Email Address of the User Account.

Parameters.Name: OfficePhone
Parameters.Description: Updated office phone of the User Account.

Parameters.Name: MobilePhone
Parameters.Description: Updated mobile phone number

Parameters.Name: Enabled
Parameters.Description: Enable the local user account.

Parameters.Name: Disabled
Parameters.Description: Disable the local user account.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: ScopePermissions
Parameters.Description:
Array collection of Hashtable<Role; Scope>.  Will overwrite existing scope to role mappings.

Example: -ScopePermissions @{Role = 'Network administrator'; Scope = (Get-HPOVScope -Name CorpNetAdmins -ErrorAction Stop) }

InputTypes.Text: HPE OneView User Account object created on an appliance

ReturnValues.Text: If successful, returns a user resource

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Update the user account 'Sally' with new roles.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Update the user account 'Sally' with a new password.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$Scope = Get-HPOVScope -Name Scope1 -ErrorAction Stop
Get-HPOVUser -Username Sally | Set-HPOVUser -Roles 'Server administrator' -ScopePermissions @{Role = 'Network administrator'; Scope = $Scope }
Examples.Description: Modify the user account with the new role and scope permissions.

Contents.Description: This cmdlet provides the ability to update the current user account password.  Only HPE OneView appliance local account passwords will be changed.  This cmdlet does not assist with modifying or updating an LDAP or Active Directory user account's password.

The new password to be set for the user account. If omitted, the cmdlet will prompt for the users password as a secure string.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Update your HPE OneView account password to the new value on all connected appliances.

Contents.Description: Generate firmware report

File system location where to save the exported report to.

Default: Current Working Directory

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

Contents.Synopsis: Show the MAC Table for Logical Interconnect resource(s).
Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will help show the MAC Table of Logical Interconnect resources.  The REST API currently limits the first 100 MAC addresses from the MAC table, regardless of the number of MAC Addresses learned in the table.

Use the -Network parameter to specify the Network Name to display learned MAC Addresses.  You can export the results to a CSV file, by providing the full path and filename to export to, using the -ExportFile parameter.

To display the results in a formatted list, use the -List parameter.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-name, -li, -LogicalInterconnect]
The Name, URI, Logical Interconnect Resource or an array of either to display the MAC Address tables from.

Parameters.Name: Network
Parameters.Description: Provide the Network Name to filter the MAC Table results for.

Parameters.Name: MacAddress
Parameters.Description: Provide a MAC Address to locate in the MAC Table.

Parameters.Name: Export
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-x, -exportFile]
Export to a CSV, provide the full path and filename.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Text: An Array of Logical Interconnect resource URI's, Names or Objects

ReturnValues.Text: Collection of MAC Address Table entries

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Return as many MAC Addresses allowed by the API for all Logical Interconnect resources.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Show-HPOVLogicalInterconnectMacTable -network VLAN100
Enclosure Interconnect    Interface Address           Type    Network   VLAN
--------- ------------    --------- -------           ----    -------   ----
Encl1      interconnect 2 LAG 27    38:22:D6:35:5A:62 Learned VLAN100  30
Encl1      interconnect 1 LAG 26    38:22:D6:35:5A:62 Learned VLAN100  30
Encl1      interconnect 1 LAG 26    78:AC:C0:72:E5:D9 Learned VLAN100  30
Examples.Description: Display all available MAC Addresses learned in 'VLAN100' network in all Logical Interconnect resources, and display in a formatted table.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Retrieve the available MAC Addresses learned in 'VLAN100' network, and export to C:\reports\Encl1-LI_vlan100_mactable.csv

Contents.Description: This cmdlet is decprecated as of v2.0.  Please use the $ConnectedSessions Global variable for appliance session information.

Contents.Synopsis: Start an HPOV Library Verbose Trace.
Contents.Description:
This Cmdlet will assist the user in setting up the PowerShell environment to generate and capture Verbose output from HPOV Library Cmdlets.  Once this Cmdlet has been executed, the prior HPOV Cmdlets can be executed, without the need of using the `-Cerbose` switch.

Cmdlet output will be captured using the built-in Microsoft PowerShell Start-Transcript provider.  A transcript trace file will be saved in either the current working directory, or specified using the `-Location` parameter.

Please know that this Cmdlet is currently not supported in the Windows PowerShell ISE, unless using PowerShell v5 or newer.

Parameters.Name: ScriptBlock
Parameters.Description: The command within a ScriptBlock to execute.  The Cmdlet will add the -Verbose switch end of the command.

Parameters.Name: Location
Parameters.Description:
Specify the directory where the output file will be created.  A file with the following format will be created:

	'{Date}_HPOV_transcript.log', where date is derived from `Get-Date -UFormat %y%m%d%H%M`

Default Value: (PWD).Path

InputTypes.Text: ScriptBlock of the command or commands to generate verbose output for.

ReturnValues.Text: FileInfo object where the '{Date}_HPOV_transcript.log' file is generated.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will update or refresh an enclosure.  An Enclosure Refresh will instruct HPE OneView to go inventory the enclosure and update any missing management configurations.

Use the -Refresh switch for scenarios where adding an enclosure results in a warning or critical error when a BL server cannot be managed due to an existing _HPOneViewAdmin account that cannot be reset or too many HP SSO Certificates are configured (iLO supports no more than 5) and you have manually cleared the HP SSO list and/or removed the _HPOneViewAdmin account.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Enclosure]
Provide the Enclosure name or Object, or [System.Collections.ArrayList] of names or Objects to refresh/update.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Refresh
Parameters.Description: Refresh the enclosure to fix configuration issues.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: When an Enclosure is in an Error state where the Primary Onboard Administrator IP Address changed, or the HPE OneView managed configuration is no longer present, you will need to provide the IP Address or FQDN of one of the Onboard Administrators in the target enclosure.  You will be prompted for this value if needed.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Provide the Username of an Onboard Administrator administrator account to re-apply the configuration if the enclosure is in an error state and the HPE OneView managed configuration is no longer present.  You will be prompted for this value if needed.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Provide the password of the Onboard Administrator administrator account to re-apply the configuration if the enclosure is in an error state and the HPE OneView managed configuration is no longer present.  You will be prompted for this value if needed.

Parameters.Name: Reapply
Parameters.Description: Reapply the Enclosure Configuration.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

ReturnValues.Text: Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Refresh all available enclosures, from all connected sessions.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Refresh 'Enclosure1' enclosure.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code: $TaskResourceToMonitor = Get-HPOVEnclosure -Name Enclosure1 | Update-HPOVEnclosure -Refresh -Hostname UpdatedOAFQDN.domain.local -Username Administrator -Password MyOAPassw0rd -Async
Examples.Description: Refresh 'Enclosure1' enclosure, supplying the updated OA FQDN and administrator credentials

Contents.Synopsis: Update or Refresh a Logical Enclosure.
Contents.Description:
This cmdlet will update or refresh a Logical Enclosure.  A Refresh will instruct HPE OneView to go inventory the enclosure and update any missing management configurations. An Update will perform Logical Enclosure compliance remediation with the parent Enclosure Group.

Use the -Refresh switch for scenarios where adding an enclosure results in a warning or critical error when a BL server cannot be managed due to an existing _HPOneViewAdmin account that cannot be reset or too many HP SSO Certificates are configured (iLO supports no more than 5) and you have manually cleared the HP SSO list and/or removed the _HPOneViewAdmin account.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-le, -LogicalEnclosure]

Provide the Logical Enclosure name, URI or Object, or [System.Collections.ArrayList ] of names, URIs or Objects to refresh/update.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: Update
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-UpdateFromEG]

Useing this switch will update the Logical Enclosure to be compliant with the Parent Enclosure Group.  Can be combined with the -WhatIf parameter to perform a Compare with group and return object with differences.

Parameters.Name: Reapply
Parameters.Description: Reapply the Enclosure Configuration.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: WhatIf
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to identify what is different or changed from the parent group policy.

InputTypes.Text:
The Cmdlet will return a compare object with the Parent and Child object and settings that are different.  Otherwise, no object is returned.

	Property Name | Description
	==========================================================
	InputObject   | Compared Object Property or Setting Value
	----------------------------------------------------------
	ParentSetting | Name of Property or Setting
	----------------------------------------------------------
	ChildSetting  | Name of Property or Setting
	----------------------------------------------------------
	Parent        | Name of Parent Object
	----------------------------------------------------------
	Child         | Name of Child Object
	----------------------------------------------------------
	Description   | Description Name of difference
	----------------------------------------------------------

ReturnValues.Text: Async task Resource object for monitoring the enclosure import process

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Refresh all available Logical Enclosures, for the default connected session.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Refresh all available Logical Enclosures, for the all connected sessions.

What if: Performing the operation "Update Logical Enclosure configuration. WARNING: Depending on this action, there might be a brief outage." on target "Encl1".

InputObject                SideIndicator ParentSetting  ChildSetting Parent            Child                   Description
-----------                ------------- -------------  ------------ ------            -----                   -----------
macRefreshInterval         <=>           7              5            Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG SETTING_MISMATCH
enablePauseFloodProtection <=>           False          True         Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG SETTING_MISMATCH
enableRichTLV              <=>           True           False        Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG SETTING_MISMATCH
enableTaggedLldp           <=>           True           False        Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG SETTING_MISMATCH
ActiveQosConfig            <=            CustomWithFCoE Passthrough  Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG SETTING_MISMATCH
Uplink Set 2               <=            Heartbeat                   Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG MISSING_NETWORK
FC Fabric B                =>                           Bay2:X8      Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG ADDITIONAL_UPLINKPORT
FC Fabric B:Bay2:X7        <=>           Auto           2Gb          Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG LINKSPEED_MISMATCH
UplinkSets                 <=            New Uplink Set              Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG MISSING_UPLINKSET
InternalNetworks           =>                           Heartbeat    Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG EXTRA_NETWORK
InternalNetworks           <=            Dev VLAN 103-A              Default VC FF LIG Encl1-Default VC FF LIG MISSING_NETWORK
Examples.Description: Refresh 'LogicalEnclosure1' Logical Enclosure.

Contents.Synopsis: Wait for Appliance services to start.
Contents.Description:
Internal module helper function to wait for the appliance services to start.  This helper function will be called by Send-HPOVRequest when the [System.Net.WebRequest] GetResponse() client generates an [Net.WebException] exception.  Then, this function will be called to provide the caller with an indication that the appliance is starting its services.  This will display two prompts:

1. An initial text-based progress bar while the System.Net.WebRequest is able to access the web service on the appliance to begin polling for service startup status.
2. Write-Progress indicator displaying the overall service startup.

If any service fails to startup, this function will cause a terminating error, informing the caller to go visit the appliance kiosk console to get more information about the startup error.

When the appliance successfully starts, this function will return.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify the appliance FQDN or IP Address without a valid connection created by using Connect-HPOVMgmt.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.
Text: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet

ReturnValues.Text: The Write-Progress cmdlet is used to display the startup progress

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Wait for the appliance to start, and specify the appliance name.

Contents.Synopsis: Wait for a task to complete.
Contents.Description:
HPE OneView utilizes a task subsystem for operations that will take longer than 200ms, and will execute them Asyncrounously.  An async task resource object is created and returned to the caller once the request has passed validation.

This blocking cmdlet assists a caller with monitoring a specific task resource, and will wait for the given task to "complete" (get to a terminal state, including error) or timeout.  The cmdlet accepts either the task URI or resource object via pipeline.  

Once the task is no longer in a running state, the cmlet will return the task resource object.  The caller should examine the taskState property/key for the final task status.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-TaskUri, -Task]
The uri of the task resource to wait for.

Parameters.Name: timeout
Parameters.Description: The timespan to wait for the task to complete.  Default is to wait for 20 minutes.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

ReturnValues.Text: The finished Task object that includes the task result

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Wait-HPOVTaskComplete /rest/tasks/F08EE040-DBA7-4806-BB62-993DD0CB4250
Waiting for task to complete...Task completed successfully!
Examples.Description: Wait for task to complete.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
Wait-HPOVTaskComplete $task -timeout (New-TimeSpan -minute 10)
Waiting for task to complete...Task completed successfully!
Examples.Description: Wait for task to complete, modifying the default timeout to 10 minutes.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Retreive the server details for ServerA, create a Server Profile and pass via pipeline the task resource object.

Contents.Description:
A scope is a grouping of resources that can be used to restrict the range of an operation or action. For example, you can create scopes based on:

	* Organizations (Marketing, Research and Development, Finance)
	* Usage (Production, Development, Testing)
	* Skills (Linux, Windows)

The resources are arranged by categories. All the resources in these categories can be added to or removed from a scope:

	* Enclosures
	* Server Hardware
	* Networks (Ethernet, FC, and FCoE)
	* Network Sets
	* Interconnects, excluding SAS resources
	* Logical Interconnects, excluding SAS resources
	* Logical Interconnect Groups, excluding SAS resources
	* Switches
	* Logical Switches
	* Logical Switch Groups

NOTE: Resources in other categories are considered to be included in all scopes, and they cannot be removed.

When scopes are defined and resources assigned to them, you can:

	* Restrict your view of the user interface (UI) to the resources in the scope.
	* Filter email notifications for alerts based on the scope of the associated resources.

Minimum required privileges: Infrastructure administrator

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Name of the scope to create.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: Administrator account of the target iLO.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s).

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this cmdlet.

Contents.Description:
This Cmdlet will add supported resources to a specified Scope..  All the resources in these categories can be added to or removed from a scope:

	* Enclosures
	* Server Hardware
	* Networks (Ethernet, FC, and FCoE)
	* Network Sets
	* Interconnects, excluding SAS resources
	* Logical Interconnects, excluding SAS resources
	* Logical Interconnect Groups, excluding SAS resources
	* Switches
	* Logical Switches
	* Logical Switch Groups

NOTE: Resources in other categories are considered to be included in all scopes, and they cannot be removed.

Minimum required privileges: Infrastructure administrator

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: The Scope resource to add the resource(s) to.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description: Specify to return asyncronous task after file upload has completed.

Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

ReturnValues.Text: Asyncronous task resource that updates the Scope and associated resources.

$Resources += Get-HPOVNetwork -Name ProdVLan* 
$Resources += Get-HPOVServer -Name Encl1* 
Get-HPOVScope -Name MyScope | Add-HPOVResourceToScope -InputObject $Resources
Examples.Description: Add the resources collected to the MyScope scope.

Contents.Synopsis: Modify an existing Storage Volume Template resource.
Contents.Description: This cmdlet will help modify an existing Storage Volume Template resource.  Only the Volume Name, Description, Capcity, Snapshot Storage Pool, volume shared state and permenance can be modified.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-SVT, -Template]

Source Storage Volume Template resource object.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Updated Storage Volume Template Name.

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: Updated description for the volume.

Parameters.Name: Capacity
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-size]
New Max volume capacity in GB.  Volume capacity can be increased to maximum of 16 TiB. Decreasing the capacity of volume is not supported. 

Before increasing the capacity of fully provisioned volumes, ensure that the storage pool has enough capacity to support the operation. The update operation might fail if there is not enough space available in the storage pool.

e.g. 20 to specify 20GB.

Parameters.Name: StoragePool
Parameters.Description: The Storage Pool Name, URI or Object to be used for Volumes

Parameters.Name: StorageSystem
Parameters.Description: When the Storage Pool name is not unique, specify the Storage System name the pool is managed/associate with.

Parameters.Name: SnapShotStoragePool
Parameters.Description: The Storage Pool Name, URI or Object to be used for Volume Snapshots.

Parameters.Name: Shared
Parameters.Description:
Include this switch to mark the Storage Volume as a Shareable resource for shared volume access.
Default: Private

Parameters.Name: Thin
Parameters.Description:
NOTE: This parameter is being deprecated for the -ProvisionType parameter. Please update your scripts.

Include to change the provisioned type to Thin.

Parameters.Name: Full
Parameters.Description:
NOTE: This parameter is being deprecated for the -ProvisionType parameter. Please update your scripts.

Include to change the provisioned type to Full.

Parameters.Name: DataProtectionLevel
Parameters.Description:
Specify the StoreVirtual protection level (aka Network RAID) for the volume.  Allowed values are:

	* NetworkRaid0None
	* NetworkRaid5SingleParity
	* NetworkRaid10Mirror2Way
	* NetworkRaid10Mirror3Way
	* NetworkRaid10Mirror4Way
	* NetworkRaid6DualParity

Parameters.Name: LockProtectionLevel
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the DataProtectionLevel value in the template.

Parameters.Name: EnableAdaptiveOptimization
Parameters.Description: Whether or not Adaptive Optimization is enabled on the storage volume.  Only supported with StoreVirtual

Parameters.Name: LockAdaptiveOptimization
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the EnableAdaptiveOptimization value in the template.

Parameters.Name: ProvisionType
Parameters.Description:
Specify the type of volume to provision.  Allowed values are:

	* Thin
	* Full
	* TPDD (Thin Provision Dedup) - Only available for HPE StoreServ storage systems with SSD storage pools (aka CPG's).

Parameters.Name: LockProvisionType
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the ProvisionType value in the template.

Parameters.Name: LockStoragePool
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the StoragePool value in the template.

Parameters.Name: LockSnapShotStoragePool
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the SnapshotStoragePool value in the template.

Parameters.Name: LockCapacity
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the Capacity value in the template.

Parameters.Name: LockProvisionMode
Parameters.Description: Specify to lock the Provision Mode (Shared or Private) value in the template.

Aliases [-Appliance]

Contents.Synopsis: Create a new Logical Switch resource.
Description:
A logical switch is added into HPE OneView as a managed or monitored logical switch. The logical switch can consist of a maximum of two physical top-of-rack switches (external to the c7000 enclosure) configured in a single stacking domain.  It is based on a logical switch group configuration. If the logical switch transitions to an Inconsistent with group state (because of changes in either the logical switch or the logical switch group), update the logical switch configuration based on the logical switch group to return to a consistent state.
You can create a logical switch with a maximum of two Cisco Nexus switches. When there are two Cisco Nexus switches in a logical switch, they are expected to be in a virtual port channel (vPC) environment. vPC must be configured on both switches, and they should belong to the same vPC domain. For information about supported switches, see the Hewlett Packard Enterprise Information Library for supportability information.
Before you add a logical switch as managed, consider the following for Fabric Extender and Virtual Connect interconnects physically connected to the logical switch:

* When only IPv4 Ethernet networks are assigned to an uplink set at creation time, the uplink set can be physically connected to any upstream switch in the logical switch.
* When an FCoE network is assigned to an uplink set at creation time, the uplink set is limited to single-homed physical connectivity and all uplink ports must connect to the same upstream switch in the logical switch.  If a port is subsequently added to the uplink set with an FCoE network or an existing port in the uplink set is connected to a second upstream switch, that port is not available for configuration and an alert is generated. If a new port added to the uplink set is connected to the same switch as the other ports, that port is available to carry traffic and an alert is not generated.  To change an uplink set from single-homed connectivity to multi-homed connectivity or vice-versa, the uplink set configuration must be deleted and re-created with the appropriate network assignments and physical configuration.
* Make sure that LLDP is enabled on the top-of-rack switch internal (downlink) ports where Virtual Connect interconnects under HPE OneView management are connected.

Adding a logical switch as monitored enables HPE OneView to monitor the logical switch for operation status, collect statistics, and alert users to specific conditions and incompatibilities between the switch and Fabric Extender or Virtual Connect interconnect. In the monitored mode, deployment of the server profile connections is supported for HPE Virtual Connect interconnects but not for Fabric Extender (FEX) interconnects.
Logical switch configuration guidelines

* When Virtual Connect interconnects are connected to a logical switch, an uplink set cannot span multiple interconnects. This limitation is similar to FEX interconnects. However, multiple uplink sets are supported on a single Virtual Connect interconnect.
* When you enable or disable a top-of-rack switch internal port, the associated port on a FEX interconnect also displays the updated port status.
* When retrieving MAC addresses for FEX interconnects, only the entries that are associated with the managed FEX interconnects are displayed.
* If an FCoE network is assigned to an uplink set that is configured as dual-homed, (an invalid configuration), that FCoE network is not provisioned on the switch. Deployment of any server profile connection with this FCoE network will fail.
* When a logical switch is defined and configured with only a single physical switch, the uplink set associated with any FEX module connected to this logical switch is considered single-homed. Therefore, you can add an FCoE network to the uplink set even if the uplink set was initially created only with Ethernet networks. Deployment of any server profile connection with this FCoE network will succeed.
* For server profiles created for server ports connected to FEX interconnects, Ethernet networks are only supported on physical function a, and FCoE networks are only supported on physical function b at the server port. When both physical functions have connections defined, traffic is split evenly across both ports.
* If HPE OneView cannot log in to the switch, a critical alert is generated. Prevent any event on the switch that might trigger switch configuration; otherwise, the switch transitions to ConfigError state and you must reapply the configuration on the associated logical interconnects to recover.
* If HPE OneView is unable to claim a member switch of the logical switch when the operational mode of the logical switch is Managed, the operating state of the switch will transition to Added with Error. In this case, the Message of the Day (MOTD) banner on the switch will indicate that the switch is currently claimed by another HPE OneView appliance and the message "This switch is being controlled by OneView Domain, Appliance ID: {}" displays. You should remove the logical switch from that HPE OneView appliance, and then perform a refresh on the logical switch from the current HPE OneView appliance to re-initiate the claim operation.
* HPE OneView does not fully automate configuration of FCoE connectivity on the switch specified in the logical switch. For each FCoE network specified in the uplink set, HPE OneView only provisions the VLAN for that network on the switch. Network administrators must provision additional configuration for FCoE connectivity manually on the switch in addition to what HPE OneView provisions.
   * To deploy server profile connections to a FEX interconnect, HPE OneView provisions the virtual Fibre Channel interface (VFC), VFC binding to FEX downlink port, and VSAN interface assignment on the switch.
   * For the deployment of server profile connections for a Virtual Connect interconnect, the Network administrator must configure the virtual Fibre Channel interface (vFC), VFC binding to server port, and VSAN interface assignment binding manually.
* When a Nexus switch expansion module is removed, a warning alert is generated unless the module is powered off.
* HPE OneView can detect configuration changes that occur on the switches specified in the logical switch when it no longer matches the configuration that HPE OneView provisions. Warning alerts are generated. Administrators can correct the configuration manually or reapply the configuration on the associated logical interconnects to recover.
Required privileges: Infrastructure administrator or Network administrator

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Name of the Logical Switch resource.  Supports wildcard * character.

Parameters.Name: LogicalSwitchGroup
Parameters.Description: Provide the Logical Switch Group policy object.

Parameters.Name: Managed
Parameters.Description: Specify if the Logical Switch will be a Managed resource.

Parameters.Name: Monitored
Parameters.Description: Specify if the Logical Switch will be a Monintored resource.

Parameters.Name: Switch1Address
Parameters.Description: IP Address or FQDN of first Switch resource.

Parameters.Name: Switch2Address
Parameters.Description: IP Address or FQDN of first Switch resource.

Parameters.Name: SshUserName
Parameters.Description: The SSH account name.

Parameters.Name: SshPassword
Parameters.Description: Password of the SSH User.  Either [System.String] or [SecureString] values are supported.

Parameters.Name: SnmpPort
Parameters.Description: The UDP port SNMP is configured to listen on the target Switch resource.

Parameters.Name: SnmpV1
Parameters.Description: Specify if SNMPv1 is available.  Otherwise, use the -SNMPv3 switch parameter.

Parameters.Name: SnmpCommunity
Parameters.Description: Specify the SNMPv1 Community name.  This parameter is not used if needing to configure SNMPv3.

Parameters.Name: SnmpV3
Parameters.Description: Specify if SNMPv3 is available.  Otherwise, use the -SNMPv1 switch parameter.

Parameters.Name: SnmpUserName
Parameters.Description: Specify the SNMPv3 Username.

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthLevel
Description:
Defines the security levels supported by SNMPv3:

* Auth         - Communication with authorization and without privacy. Messages are authenticated but not encrypted.
* AuthAndPrive - Communication with authorization as well as privacy. Messages are authenticated as well as encrypted.

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthProtocol
Parameters.Description: The protocol used for Authentication are either MD5 (Message Digest 5) or SHA (Secure Hash Algorithm).

Parameters.Name: SnmpAuthPassword
Parameters.Description: SNMPv3 Authorization Password.  Either [System.String] or [SecureString] values are supported.

Parameters.Name: SnmpPrivProtocol
Parameters.Description: The protocols used to encrypt the messages are Data Encryption Standard (DES56) or Advanced Encryption Standard (AES128).

Parameters.Name: SnmpPrivPassword
Parameters.Description: SNMPv3 Privacy Password.  Either [System.String] or [SecureString] values are supported.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Aliases [-Appliance]

Specify one or more HPOneView.Appliance.Connection object(s) or Name property value(s). If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectedSessions} | ? Default

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$LogicalSwitchGroup = Get-HPOVLogicalSwitchGroup -Name "My Nexus 5500 Switch Group Policy"
$SshPassword = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "MyPassword" -AsPlainText -Force
New-HPOVLogicalSwitch -Name "My Logical Switch 1" -LogicalSwitchGroup $LogicalSwitchGroup -Monitored -Switch1Address 10.1.1.1 -Switch2Address 10.1.1.2 -SshUserName admin -SshPassword $SshPassword -Snmpv1 -SnmpCommunity MyCommunity
Examples.Description: Create the "My Logical Switch 1" as a Monitored Logical Switch resource.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$LogicalSwitchGroup = Get-HPOVLogicalSwitchGroup -Name "My Nexus 6001 Switch Group Policy"
$Password = ConvertTo-SecureString -String "MyPassword" -AsPlainText -Force
$Results = New-HPOVLogicalSwitch -Name "My Logical Switch 2" -LogicalSwitchGroup $LogicalSwitchGroup -Managed -Switch1Address 10.1.2.1 -Switch2Address 10.1.2.2 -SshUserName admin-SshPassword $Password -Snmpv3 -SnmpUserName SnmpV3User -SnmpAuthLevel AuthAndPriv -SnmpAuthProtocol SHA -SnmpAuthPassword $Password -SnmpPrivProtocol aes128 -SnmpPrivPassword $Password -Async
Examples.Description: Create the "My Logical Switch 2" as a Managed Logical Switch resource.

Description:
The logical switch group is a template for creating logical switches. Logical switches are an aggregation of up to two physical top-of-rack switches.
Once constructed from a logical switch group, a logical switch continues to be associated with its logical switch group. Any change in consistency between the logical switch group and its associated logical switches is monitored and made visible on the associated logical switch screen in HPE OneView.
This Cmdlet will retrieve the specified or all Logical Switch Group resources.

Contents.Synopsis: Create a new Logical Switch Group resource.
Description:
The logical switch group is a template for creating logical switches. Logical switches are an aggregation of up to two physical top-of-rack switches.
Once constructed from a logical switch group, a logical switch continues to be associated with its logical switch group. Any change in consistency between the logical switch group and its associated logical switches is monitored and made visible on the associated logical switch screen in HPE OneView.
This Cmdlet will help create a Logical Switch Group resources.  Only the following switch model family's are supported:
* Cisco Nexus 5000
* Cisco Nexus 5500
* Cisco Nexus 5600
* Cisco Nexus 6000
Please refer to either Get-HPOVSwitchType values, or the HPE OneView Support Matrix for which specific models are supported.
Required privileges: Infrastructure administrator or Network administrator
